0.title: Justice Uday Umesh Lalit appointed 49th Chief Justice of India
0.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu has appointed Justice Uday Umesh Lalit as the 49th Chief Justice of India (CJI), accepting the recommendation made by the outgoing CJI NV Ramana. The 48th Chief Justice of India, Ramana, will retire on August 26. Justice Lalit was appointed judge at the Supreme Court in 2014. He had enrolled as an advocate in June 1983.

1.title: I'd rather have rumours about me than be a nobody: Vijay on link-up with Rashmika
1.article_body: Addressing the link-up reports with actress Rashmika Mandanna, actor Vijay Deverakonda said he feels rumours are just collateral damage of being a public figure. "I'd rather...have these rumours written about me than be a nobody and have nothing written about me," Vijay said. "When people love you...[they] want to know more about you...I'm ok with it," he added.

2.title: SoftBank to record $34 bn gain by cutting stake in Alibaba to 14.6%
2.article_body: SoftBank Group on Wednesday said it will book an estimated gain of 4.6 trillion yen ($34.08 billion) using shares in Alibaba Group Holding, reducing its stake from 23.7% to 14.6%. The transaction "will be able to eliminate concerns about future cash flows", SoftBank said. SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son had bought Alibaba shares for $20 million in 2000.

3.title: I don't think I'm a perfectionist, media gave me this tag: Aamir Khan
3.article_body: Aamir Khan, who is often termed a 'perfectionist', in a recent interview said he doesn't believe in perfection. "I find that beauty lies in imperfection," the 'Laal Singh Chaddha' actor said. "I think this tag was given to me by the media because I'd a very long period in which I didn't have a film that didn't work," he added.

4.title: Man claiming to be army official cheats Mumbai doctor of ₹2.71 lakh
4.article_body: A 48-year-old doctor from Mumbai alleged that a man claiming to be an army official siphoned off ₹2.71 lakh from her bank account. She claimed she got a video call from the man who said that he wanted to get blood test done for 25 people. On the pretext of making payment, he convinced her to share her account details.

5.title: RBI releases first set of guidelines for digital lending
5.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday released the first set of guidelines for digital lending. The regulatory framework is based on the principle that lending business can be carried out only by entities that are either regulated by RBI or are permitted to do so under any law. Among the guidelines, RBI classified all digital lenders into three categories.

6.title: My mother joked, 'No one will marry you': Vijay Varma on 'Darlings'
6.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma said his mother had the funniest reaction to his character in 'Darlings'. In a statement, Vijay said, "She watched the film and called me in panic. She was worried that no one would marry her son now." The actor played Hamza, the role of an abusive husband, in 'Darlings', which is Alia Bhatt's maiden production venture.

7.title: Dalit Panchayat President stopped from hoisting flag at TN school
7.article_body: Ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, a Dalit Panchayat President of a village in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi has been allegedly stopped from hoisting the tricolour at a government school. The woman, Sudha V, has sought police assistance over the issue. Sudha stated that she was stopped by the Parent Teacher Association as she hails from the SC community.

8.title: Apple supplier Foxconn reports 12% profit in June quarter
8.article_body: Apple's supplier Foxconn reported a 12% jump in second-quarter net profit, aided by strong demand for its cloud computing products. The Taiwan-based company said that net profit for the April-June quarter rose to T$33.29 billion from T$29.78 billion a year ago. Experts have warned that Apple should brace for softer demand in China as COVID-19 lockdowns have affected the economy.

9.title: Nitish Kumar will never be PM, chair reserved for PM Modi: Nityanand Rai
9.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will "never be the Prime Minister" as the post is "reserved" for PM Narendra Modi, Union Minister Nityanand Rai said while addressing speculations about Kumar's national ambitions. "[Kumar's] move has proved that he does everything only for power," Rai said. "The people of...the entire country...[have] blessed Narendra Modi to be the PM for lifetime," he added.

10.title: Speeding car runs over Class 12 student in Gurugram: Police
10.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday said that a Class 12 student died and his classmate was injured when a speeding car hit their scooty in the Farrukhnagar area on Monday. The car driver managed to flee, leaving his vehicle behind, the police added. The accident occurred when the students were returning home from school.

11.title: India could be Asia's strongest economy in 2022-23: Morgan Stanley
11.article_body: India could emerge as Asia's strongest economy in 2022-2023 with an expected average growth of 7%, Morgan Stanley economists said. The brokerage expects the country to contribute 28% and 22% to Asian and global growth, respectively. Buoyed by business investments, economic policy reforms and a young workforce, India is in a good position to generate robust domestic demand, it said.

12.title: Agritech startup Produze raises $2.6 million in seed funding
12.article_body: Agritech startup Produze secured $2.6 million in a seed funding round led by venture capital firms Accel and All In Capital. The startup's Co-founder and CEO Ben Mathew told Moneycontrol that the funds will be used to expand procurement sources and strengthen the tech team. Produze is a business-to-business (B2B) platform that aims to connect farm producers and international retailers.

13.title: SC clubs and transfers all FIRs filed against Nupur Sharma to Delhi Police
13.article_body: The Supreme Court has clubbed and transferred all FIRs lodged in several states against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks on the Prophet Mohammad to Delhi Police, saying that it has taken note of the serious threat to her life. The court also added that till the probe is completed, protection from arrest to Sharma shall continue.

14.title: Such players are needed in the team: Kiran More on Hardik Pandya
14.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More has praised all-rounder Hardik Pandya for the way the 28-year-old has made his comeback to the team. More stated that players who can "bowl four overs, take wickets [and] get runs for the team" are needed in the playing XI. Hardik is part of India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup.

15.title: BJP, Cong speak against each other & leave, never talk about welfare: Kejriwal
15.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday in Gujarat said that BJP and Congress come, speak against each other and leave. "[They] never talk about the welfare of people. We take up issues of electricity and employment," Kejriwal added. "We made electricity free in Delhi, Punjab...will do same in three months of being elected here," he stated.

16.title: More work needs to be done to reset China-Aus ties: Chinese envoy
16.article_body: The Chinese Ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, on Wednesday said that more work needs to be done to reset relations between China and Australia. The two nations had not yet reached the stage of resolving political and trade disputes, he added. Notably, leaders of the two countries have not met in recent years.

17.title: TV actors Dheeraj Dhoopar, Vinny Arora blessed with a baby boy
17.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' actor Dheeraj Dhoopar and his wife, actress Vinny Arora have been blessed with their first child, a baby boy. The duo took to Instagram to share the news. The couple had announced the pregnancy in April this year. Several actors including Jay Bhanushali, Divyanka Tripathi Dahiya, Shiny Doshi and Tina Datta congratulated the couple in the comments section.

18.title: My heart swells with pride when I see you lead Vedanta: Anil Agarwal on daughter's b'day
18.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal on Wednesday wrote a note for his daughter Priya Agarwal Hebbar on her birthday. He wrote, "My heart swells with pride when I watch you lead Vedanta with dedication and passion…It is such a joy to see you give your all into everything you do". Priya is currently the Director at Vedanta Resources.

19.title: Has power to burrow into minds and hearts: Twinkle on 'Raksha...'
19.article_body: Twinkle Khanna said 'Raksha Bandhan' is a film "about the India we all pretend doesn't exist". The former actress shared a note in which she said the Akshay Kumar film has the "power to burrow into the minds and hearts of people across the board". She said the film will leave the audience teary-eyed. 'Raksha Bandhan' also stars Bhumi Pednekar.

20.title: Trishala's b'day always 'one of the greatest moments of my life': Sanjay
20.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt posted a throwback photo of his daughter Trishala Dutt to wish her on her 34th birthday. Sharing the picture, which also featured him, Sanjay wrote that her birthday "will always be one of the greatest moments of my life". He continued, "Nothing lights up my world like you @trishaladutt! Happy Birthday my princess, Papa Dukes loves you."

21.title: Tried dismissing Sehwag with short ball, it went over stadium for six: Lee
21.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said the Australian team would try to bowl a short ball to Virender Sehwag, to encourage him to hit the ball down to third man. "We tried it in an ODI, I bowled...[a] short [ball] and thought he'll...fall for the trap...It went over the stadium for six," added Lee. "He'd give...[a] cheeky little wink," stated Lee.

22.title: Shameful over Partha’s case but we aren’t cut from same cloth: TMC leader
22.article_body: TMC leader Firhad Hakim on Wednesday said, "We feel shame over the Partha Chatterjee case." Furthermore, he said, "It doesn't mean that we are all cut from the same cloth. We did not devote much of our lives to public service only to be defamed as corrupt people." Ex-Bengal minister Chatterjee was arrested in alleged job scam case.

23.title: Gaming startup Lysto raises $12 mn in pre-Series A funding round
23.article_body: Singapore and Bengaluru-based gaming startup Lysto has raised $12 million in a pre-Series A funding round. The funding round saw participation from investors such as Square Peg, BEENEXT, Hashed, Tiger Global, and Better Capital, and some angel investors. Lysto was founded in 2021 by Sadiq Ahamed, and builds APIs, NFTs and allied tools for online gamers.

24.title: Mumbai Police waits 4 days to get confession from arrested intoxicated thief
24.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly burgling a house in Mumbai's Trombay, but the police had to wait for four days to interrogate him, as he was intoxicated at the time of his arrest. However, the police were able to recover the stolen valuables worth almost ₹2 lakh. The accused committed the crime because of unemployment, an official said.

25.title: Telangana govt approves funding for road improvements in Hyderabad
25.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits has been sanctioned funds by the Telangana government to make improvements to the roads in the city. Local leaders and residents have appreciated the step. Anil Kumar, a local leader from the Nampally area, thanked the Telangana government and Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao, and said that development works have made residents happy.

26.title: Former Twitter employee convicted of spying for Saudi Arabia
26.article_body: Ahmad Abouammo, a Lebanese-US national and a former Twitter employee, has been convicted of spying for the Saudi Arabian government. After a two-and-a-half-week trial, Abouammo was found guilty of six charges including money laundering, fraud and acting as an illegal agent for a foreign government. FBI said that Abouammo used his position to access confidential user data.

27.title: Tabu gets injured while driving truck in jungle during film shoot: Reports
27.article_body: Actress Tabu got injured while driving a truck in a jungle in Hyderabad during the shoot of Ajay Devgn directorial 'Bholaa', reports said. A bike chasing the truck collided with it, following which a piece of shredded glass flew and cut Tabu just above her right eye, reports added. The shoot was then briefly halted, reports further stated.

28.title: Delhi airport's 4th runway to be operational by early 2023: AAI
28.article_body: The fourth runway at Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport is set to get operational by early 2023 with the completion of instrument landing system installation and other works such as painting runway markings and calibration by December, the Airports Authority of India (AAI) said. With this, IGI airport will become the only Indian airport to have four runways.

29.title: Godavari crosses first danger mark in Andhra for second month in a row
29.article_body: Godavari river crossed the first danger mark at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage at Dowlaiswaram in Andhra Pradesh for the second month in a row on Wednesday. State Disaster Management Authority MD BR Ambedkar on Wednesday morning said Godavari's inflow stood at 10.27 lakh cusecs. Officials of districts along the river have accordingly been alerted to take precautionary measures, Ambedkar said.

30.title: UK plans blackouts in Jan as part of emergency energy plan: Report
30.article_body: Under the government's ''reasonable worst-case scenario'', UK could face an electricity shortfall leading to four-day organised blackouts for households and industries in January, a Bloomberg report said. This is because of reduced energy imports from Norway and France. However, the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy said the scenario is ''not something we expect to happen''.

31.title: Homeless man carrying knife at Paris airport shot dead by police
31.article_body: Police officers on Wednesday shot dead a knife-wielding man at Paris' Charles de Gaulle International airport. The man, who was reportedly homeless, brandished a knife at the officials after cursing at them near one of the airport's terminals. He was reportedly shot at after refusing to put down the knife despite repeated requests by the authorities.

32.title: Drug firm Pfizer's MD S Sridhar resigns to take early retirement
32.article_body: Drug firm Pfizer on Wednesday said its Managing Director S Sridhar has resigned from the company as he intended to take early retirement. Sridhar has held several key positions in the company over the past 14 years. He was the MD for the past six years and would continue in the role until his replacement is selected, Pfizer said.

33.title: Cloud kitchen startup BigSpoon raises ₹100 cr in Series A funding
33.article_body: Ahmedabad-based cloud kitchen startup BigSpoon has secured ₹100 crore in Series A funding round which saw participation of Bollywood actor and investor Mouni Roy. IAN, NB Ventures, Go Ventures, LetsVenture, Grip Invest and Anicut Capital also participated in the round. The firm said it will use funds to hire people for leadership roles and invest in technology for clients.

34.title: We'll give bumper jobs in 1 month, it'll be so grand it's never happened before: Tejashwi
34.article_body: After taking oath as Bihar Deputy CM on Wednesday, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said that the state government will give "bumper" jobs to the poor and youth within one month. "It will be something so grand that it's never happened before," he added. "Bihar did what the country needs to do," Tejashwi further said.

35.title: My family being harassed at behest of BJP MP Sharma: Shrikant Tyagi's wife
35.article_body: Anu Tyagi, wife of self-claimed BJP leader Shrikant Tyagi, on Wednesday said that her family was being harassed at the behest of BJP MP Mahesh Sharma. When asked about Mahesh Sharma's denial that Shrikant Tyagi was a BJP member, she said, "My husband was a BJP member. I was not tortured physically, but I was harassed mentally," she said.

36.title: Sisodia demands CBI inquiry into alleged ₹6,000 cr toll tax scam in MCD
36.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has written to Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena demanding a CBI inquiry into the alleged toll tax scam worth ₹6,000 crore in the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). This comes after AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak on Tuesday claimed that tax is collected from around 10 lakh commercial vehicles daily but it does not reach MCD.

37.title: 'Get well soon' wishes pour in as Raju Srivastava suffers heart attack
37.article_body: 'Get well soon' messages and health wishes poured in for comedian Raju Srivastava on Twitter after he suffered a heart attack while working out at a gym in Delhi on Wednesday. Comedian Sunil Pal shared a video stating Raju is out of danger and said, "Get well soon bhai...Stay healthy." News anchor Shantanu Kumar tweeted, "Wishing you a speedy recovery."

38.title: Coinbase reports $1.1 billion net loss in Q2, revenue drops 60%
38.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase reported operating loss of $1.04 billion in second quarter compared to $874.7 million operating profit in the corresponding period last year, leading to its stock to close 10.5% lower on Tuesday. Its revenue fell around 60% from year-ago period. "Dramatic market movements shifted user behaviour and trading volume, which impacted transaction revenue," company said.

39.title: Rahul's inclusion in squad for Asia Cup shows how valuable he is: Styris
39.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said KL Rahul's inclusion in India's squad for the Asia Cup and being named the vice-captain shows how valuable he is to the team. "Rahul was always the frontline player in this Indian side...I guess it's unlucky for Ishan Kishan," added Styris. Rahul hasn't played any competitive cricket since IPL 2022.

40.title: JSW Energy unit to buy Mytrah Energy's renewable assets for ₹10,530 cr
40.article_body: JSW Energy’s wholly owned subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, on Wednesday said that it has agreed to acquire a portfolio of 1,753 MW of renewable energy generation capacity from Mytrah Energy (India) for ₹10,530 crore. This is JSW Energy’s largest acquisition since its inception and will help achieve its renewable-led capacity growth target by FY25, well ahead of timelines, it said.

41.title: Hindalco's Q1 net profit surges 48% to ₹4,119 cr, revenue up 40%
41.article_body: Hindalco Industries Limited on Wednesday reported a 48% surge in consolidated net profit to ₹4,119 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹2,787 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue also rose 40% year-on-year to ₹58,018 crore compared to ₹41,358 crore. The company's shares closed 4.41% higher at ₹440.05 on the BSE.

42.title: You are such a strong woman: Caitlyn on Khloe welcoming 2nd child
42.article_body: Caitlyn Jenner took to Twitter to congratulate Khloe Kardashian after she welcomed her second child on Friday. Jenner tweeted, "I love you so much! You are such a strong woman. And what an amazing mother!" Khloe had her second baby with Tristan Thompson despite their break-up. Khloe welcomed the child via surrogate.

43.title: How did I let that happen?: Amanda Seyfried on filming nude scenes at 19
43.article_body: Talking about filming nude scenes at 19, actress Amanda Seyfried, who starred in 'Mean Girls' said, "Being 19, walking around without my underwear on, like, are you kidding me? How did I let that happen?" "I was 19...I did not want to upset anybody and I wanted to keep my job. That is why," added Seyfried.

44.title: Nitish Kumar countered era of backdoor politics very well: TRS MLC
44.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Bihar, TRS MLC K Kavitha said that it’s a positive change for the whole nation. "The era of backdoor politics has been countered very well by Nitish Kumar," Kavitha added. "I appreciate the efforts he has taken and 'Mahagathbandhan' which stood behind him to uphold the verdict given by people of Bihar," Kavitha stated.

45.title: BJP finishes off its allies, Nitish Kumar made a wise decision: Pawar
45.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday accused BJP of finishing off its regional allies gradually and supported Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's decision to sever ties with the party. "He took the decision, anticipating the crisis the BJP was planning to bring on. I think he took a wise decision for his state and party," Pawar said.

46.title: Nitish Kumar will take advantage of Lalu's illness to try & split RJD: BJP
46.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday said that Nitish Kumar will cause a split in RJD by taking advantage of Lalu Prasad Yadav's illness. "We would like to see how the new Bihar government functions with Tejashwi as de facto CM; it will fall before the next polls," the BJP leader said.

47.title: BJP can say anything, whether I stay till 2024 or not, I'll not stay in 2014: Nitish
47.article_body: After taking oath as Bihar CM, Nitish Kumar told journalists that BJP can say what they want. He said, "Whether I stay till 2024 or not, but I will not stay in 2014." He also said, "Those who came to power in 2014, will they be victorious in 2024?", adding that he wants the Opposition to be united for 2024.

48.title: Restore senior citizen rebate in sleeper, AC 3-tier: Parliamentary panel
48.article_body: A Parliamentary panel has urged the Ministry of Railways to review and "urgently" restore the rebate given to senior citizens at least for sleeper and AC 3-tier classes. Senior citizens were earlier given concessions amounting to 40-50% of their railway fares. The government had earlier withdrawn the concessions in view of the COVID-19 pandemic.

49.title: I don't care about what people are saying: Shubman Gill on his strike rate
49.article_body: India opener Shubman Gill has said he doesn't care about what people are saying over his strike rate in white-ball cricket. "I feel questions will always be raised, but I don't care...as long as I'm doing what my team management and my captain expect of me." Shubman scored 64(53), 43(49) and 98*(98) in the three-match ODI series against West Indies.

50.title: Mumbai man forcefully tries to open metro platform door; trains detained
50.article_body: A man forcefully tried to open the platform screen door at Mumbai's Dahisar East metro station on Sunday. His actions triggered the alarm on the door, which automatically stopped all trains from entering the station. Metro officials reportedly fixed the problem within two minutes. The man's actions were caught on a CCTV camera.

51.title: Pakistani woman attempts to cross border for Hyderabadi lover; arrested
51.article_body: A Pakistani woman was arrested along with two aides at the India-Nepal border for allegedly trying to cross into India illegally. The accused, Kalija Noor from Faisalabad in Pakistan, fell in love with a Hyderabad-based man Ahmed, whom she met online. Ahmed arranged for Noor to enter India, but she was caught carrying fabricated documents by the border security agency.

52.title: 'Laal…' stars Aamir, Mona Singh seek blessings at Golden Temple, pic surfaces
52.article_body: Bollywood actor Aamir Khan on Wednesday visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar to seek blessings for his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The actor was accompanied by actress Mona Singh, who plays his mother in the Advait Chandan directorial. Earlier this week, Aamir paid tribute to war heroes at the National War Memorial in Delhi.

53.title: Rarely emotional but got carried away: Akshay on crying after sister's message
53.article_body: Having been left in tears after listening to his sister's message on a reality show, actor Akshay Kumar said, "I rarely get emotional during a show. But when I saw the video...I got carried away." "We used to live in a small house. After the arrival of this goddess, our lives changed," Akshay had earlier stated, referring to his sister.

54.title: Murder of democracy: Shiv Sena on Maharashtra govt expansion in Saamana
54.article_body: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' criticised the coalition between the party's Eknath Shinde camp and BJP, a day after the Maharashtra government expanded the cabinet. "It is the murder of democracy and the Constitution to administer oath to some of the legislators whose disqualification petitions are being heard by the Supreme Court," the editorial said.

55.title: Hope political stability returns to Bihar now: Prashant Kishor
55.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Bihar, poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Wednesday said this era of political instability has been ongoing for past 10 years. "I hope political stability returns to Bihar now. Nitish Kumar has said that he is starting a new chapter," Kishor added. "I hope he fulfils the aspirations of the people of Bihar," Kishor stated.

56.title: Shortcomings in security at 3 railway stations, shopping centres: Delhi Police
56.article_body: Delhi Police has said that security protocols are not being followed at the New Delhi, Shivaji Bridge and Tughlakabad railway stations and at markets in Vasant Lok, South Extension II and Nehru Place. "Several shortcomings have been noticed in various hotels...taxi stands...cinemas and malls," DCP IP Singh said. The police found that some hotels don't even have a valid licence.

57.title: Shilpa Shetty breaks her leg while shooting, shares pic
57.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram to share a picture of herself sitting in a wheelchair after breaking her leg during a shoot. She wrote, "They said, 'Roll camera action - break a leg!' I took it literally...Out of action for 6 weeks...but I'll be back soon stronger and better." She added, "Till then, dua mein yaad rakhiyega...Prayers always work."

58.title: Important for me to voice my opinion: Ananya on her remarks on 'Arjun Reddy'
58.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday opened up about her comments on Vijay Deverakonda's 'Arjun Reddy' on 'Koffee with Karan 7'. "It's important for me to voice my opinion and speak up about topics I feel strongly about," Ananya said. In the show, Ananya had said she wouldn't be fine with someone like the male lead in 'Arjun Reddy'.

59.title: It is the most relatable film I’ve made: Aanand on 'Raksha Bandhan'
59.article_body: Director Aanand L Rai, speaking about his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', has said that it is the most relatable film he has made. "I don't know how much it will be liked...I do know that nobody can dislike it. 'Raksha Bandhan' cannot fail to touch the hearts of every Indian," he added. The film features Akshay Kumar and Bhumi Pednekar.

60.title: Tejashwi is the real CM of Bihar, Nitish just for show: BJP's Sushil Modi
60.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi said that in the new 'Mahagathbandhan' government in Bihar, Nitish Kumar will be CM just for show and the real CM will be Tejashwi Yadav. "[RJD] have a strength of 80, [JDU] have 45-46. Everyone knows how Lalu Yadav works," he added. "The 2020 mandate was for PM Narendra Modi," he further said.

61.title: Tesla lobbying to set up 'advanced manufacturing facility' in Canada
61.article_body: Tesla is lobbying the Canadian government to set up an "advanced manufacturing facility", a filing by the firm showed. Tesla is working with the government to "identify opportunities for industrial facility permitting reforms", the amended filing from July 18 said. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said last week the company "might be able" to announce a new factory later this year.

62.title: Tejashwi touches CM Nitish's feet, both hug after he takes oath as Bihar Deputy CM
62.article_body: After taking oath as the Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar on Wednesday, Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav touched Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's feet and both hugged each other. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Notably, Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish on Wednesday took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time in his political career.

63.title: I didn't know if he would turn up on set: Deverakonda on Mike Tyson
63.article_body: Discussing American boxing legend Mike Tyson who'll feature in actor Vijay Deverakonda's film 'Liger', Deverakonda said, "He has such a huge image preceding him." "When we landed in Las Vegas, I...didn't know if he was going to turn up on set...Is he actually going to come?" added Deverakonda. "[When I saw him] I was like 'Oh F***', he's...here," he stated.

64.title: 2 men steal bikes, sell them posing as policemen in Pune; arrested
64.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested two men for allegedly stealing bikes and selling them in rural areas of Pune posing as policemen. The police revealed that they recovered 14 stolen bikes, a fake police identity card and a uniform. The accused sold bikes dressed as policemen to gain people's trust, said Senior Inspector of Chinchwad police station, Krushnadev Kharade.

65.title: Very concerned about reports of Rwanda backing rebels in Congo: US
65.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday said America is "very concerned" about what he called credible reports that Rwanda has provided support to M23 rebels in the neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). He called on all parties to halt any support for or cooperation with M23 or other non-state armed groups. Blinken is visiting the DRC.

66.title: KL Rahul's lack of cricket would be a concern for India: Jayawardena
66.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said KL Rahul hasn't played much cricket recently having been sidelined since IPL 2022, which would be a concern for Team India. Rahul has been included in the squad for Asia Cup 2022. "Having game time [in the middle] is quite crucial," added Jayawardena. Rahul underwent groin surgery in June and recently recovered from COVID-19.

67.title: Woman assaulted over broken glass by hotel owner in Pune, injured
67.article_body: A female customer suffered serious injuries after she was allegedly assaulted over confusion about broken glass by a hotel owner in Pimpri-Chinchwad on Monday. According to the police complaint, a staffer while serving food to the woman at the hotel broke a glass, which the establishment's owner held the woman responsible for. She was then assaulted while leaving the premises.

68.title: B'desh's foreign reserves are good, won't see crisis as SL: Power Min
68.article_body: Amid raging protests against rising fuel prices, Bangladeshi Power Minister Nasrul Hamid said Bangladesh will not see a similar crisis like Sri Lanka as it has "good foreign currency reserves". Fuel is the lifeline of any country's economy and Bangladesh has sufficient reserves of petroleum products, he added. Bangladesh last week increased fuel prices by over 50%, its highest-ever increase.

69.title: Nitish didn't want an alliance with BJP, so he joined another: Kishor
69.article_body: A day after Nitish Kumar severed his ties with BJP to join hands with RJD, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that the JD(U) chief wasn't comfortable in the alliance with BJP, so he joined another. "When taking such a huge U-turn, you sometimes have to set the moral high ground aside for a while," Kishor said.

70.title: Delhi LG lays foundation stone for city's first bamboo park along Yamuna
70.article_body: Delhi's Lieutenant Governor (LG) Vinai Kumar Saxena laid the foundation stone for city's first bamboo theme park on Yamuna riverfront on Tuesday. The park is a part of the river's ongoing rejuvenation project. Around 20,000 bamboo saplings of 15 varieties will be planted there, and it'll spread over 10 hectares on the western bank near the Delhi-Meerut Expressway, officials said.

71.title: It's unfortunate, but Virat has tools to come out of form slump: Jayawardena
71.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has said it's unfortunate what Virat Kohli is going through, but the former India captain has the tools to come out of his poor form. "I'm sure he'll come through this," added Jayawardena. Kohli has returned to the squad for the upcoming Asia Cup after being rested for the West Indies tour.

72.title: 8-yr-old boy drowns after falling into uncovered drain in Gurugram
72.article_body: An 8-year-old boy was reportedly swept away after falling into an uncovered drain while playing outside his house in Gurugram's Gadoli Khurd village on Sunday. He had gone to pick something up when he might have slipped into the drain, the boy's family, who suspect he has drowned, said. "The incident took place due to...negligence of authorities," his uncle alleged.

73.title: Pune's PMPML to run more than 50 additional buses on Raksha Bandhan
73.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has announced that it will be running 54 additional buses on Thursday on the occasion of Raksha Bandhan. More than 1,800 buses will be made available for passengers of Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad. The buses will ply mainly from bus stands at Katraj, Chinchwad Gaon, Nigdi, Saswad, Hadapsar, Wagholi, Jejuri, Alandi, Talegaon, Bhosari and Ranjangaon.

74.title: Acid attack on 23-yr-old woman in B'luru pre-planned: K'taka Police
74.article_body: Karnataka Police, in its 770-page charge-sheet in connection with the April 28 acid attack on a 23-year-old woman in Bengaluru, said that the attack was pre-planned. The man, arrested in the case, had planned a similar attack in 2020 and procured nine litres of sulphuric acid. "He had been stalking the woman for more than seven years," police said.

75.title: Virat Kohli drops to 32nd position in latest T20I rankings, full list released
75.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has dropped to the 32nd position in the latest rankings for T20I batters. Meanwhile, Suryakumar Yadav remains on the second position and is now 13 rating points behind first-placed Babar Azam. Shreyas Iyer has jumped six places to the 19th position, while Rishabh Pant jumped seven places to be ranked 59th.

76.title: Snap Inc extends paid subscription service Snapchat+ to India
76.article_body: Snapchat-parent Snap Inc has extended its paid subscription service Snapchat+ to Indian users for a monthly fee of ₹49. The subscription unlocks a collection of exclusive, experimental and pre-release features targeted at power users and includes the recently launched Snapchat for Web, which lets users chat with their friends via video call. It'll also offer ability to change app icons.

77.title: Russian security forces raid anti-war TV journalist's house: Lawyer
77.article_body: Former state TV journalist in Russia Marina Ovsyannikova's lawyer said Russian state security services searched her house. In a statement on Telegram, the lawyer said a criminal case had been opened against the journalist under a Russian law that criminalises spreading fake news about Russian army. In March, Ovsyannikova had protested against war in Ukraine during a live news show.

78.title: Hong Kong bankers turn billionaires briefly as firm's stock jumps 6,000% before crashing
78.article_body: Two founders of a Hong Kong investment bank briefly became billionaires after the shares of their company, Magic Empire Global, surged 6,149% since debuting in the US on Friday but crashed 89% on Tuesday. Gilbert Chan and Johnson Chen’s stakes worth $1.8 billion and $1.3 billion were reduced to $90 million and $65 million, respectively.

79.title: Materials worth lakhs gutted in fire at Hyderabad's Kishan Bagh
79.article_body: Materials worth lakhs of rupees were gutted down in a fire mishap reported near Mahek Garden Function Hall at Kishan Bagh in Hyderabad on Wednesday morning. The fire started in a row of warehouses where coal, clothes and mattress are stored and sold, the fire officials said. Short circuit is suspected to be the cause of fire by fire officials.

80.title: Dad Chunky used to say, 'You have to do a massy film': Ananya Panday
80.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday, in an interview, said, "My dad (Chunky Panday)...since I started, when I discussed about movies with mom, he used to say, 'You have to do a massy film'." She added that massy cinema was Chunky's brand of cinema as he was part of it and he "loved" watching as an audience. Ananya will feature in 'Liger'.

81.title: We deserve to celebrate silver: PR Sreejesh on criticism after 0-7 loss
81.article_body: Following criticism over the Indian men's hockey team's 0-7 defeat against Australia in their gold medal match at CWG 2022, the team's goalkeeper PR Sreejesh tweeted, "We deserve to celebrate this silver." "We didn't win gold. I know what happened...even you know," added Sreejesh. Ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha had tweeted he was "really heartbroken" by the loss.

82.title: Avesh Khan is slightly behind Arshdeep for T20 WC spot: Manjrekar
82.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said Avesh Khan is slightly behind Arshdeep Singh for a spot in India's squad for the T20 World Cup. "Because Arshdeep is doing what Avesh's role is, to go with the new ball in the middle and in the death [also]," stated Manjrekar. Notably, both Arshdeep and Avesh are in squad for the Asia Cup.

83.title: 20-yr-old Guj man posts videos with liquor bottles, 'challenges' police; arrested
83.article_body: A 20-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly uploading videos showing liquor bottles on social media and "challenging the police" in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The accused’s videos surfaced on social media in which he was seen using "filmy dialogues" as superimposed audio on his videos. The videos were broadcasted by local TV news channels in the wake of the recent hooch tragedy.

84.title: Japan PM reshuffles cabinet amid concerns over Unification Church ties
84.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has reshuffled cabinet to remove some ministers with links to the Unification Church amid rising public anger and plunging support. Nobuo Kishi, former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's younger brother is one of the high-profile ministers to be removed. Abe's suspected killer said his mother went bankrupt after she donated to the group.

85.title: Stranded beluga whale rescued from France's Seine river after 6-hr operation
85.article_body: A beluga whale, stranded in the Seine river in France since Friday, was rescued early on Wednesday. It took the rescue team nearly six hours to lift the 800-kg whale out of the water and onto a barge. Authorities are now transporting the whale in a refrigerated lorry to a saltwater basin in Normandy in hopes of saving its life.

86.title: Sri Lanka's ousted Prez Rajapaksa likely to fly to Thailand: Reports
86.article_body: Sri Lanka's ousted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is likely to head to Thailand on Thursday to seek temporary shelter, according to reports. On July 14, Rajapaksa went to Singapore via Maldives after people of Sri Lanka took to the streets to protest against political and economic crisis. Singapore's Foreign Minister had said that Rajapaksa has not been given privileges or immunity.

87.title: Nitish Kumar takes oath as Bihar CM for 8th time, Tejashwi Yadav takes oath as his deputy
87.article_body: JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar on Wednesday took oath as Bihar Chief Minister for the eighth time in his political career. Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav took oath as the Deputy CM of the state. It comes a day after Kumar called off the Janata Dal (United) and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led NDA coalition and announced a 'Mahagathbandhan' of seven parties.

88.title: BJP made Nitish Kumar CM of Bihar 5 times, RJD did it twice: Sushil Modi
88.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi criticised Nitish Kumar for breaking alliance with BJP and said that BJP has never betrayed anyone. "We made Nitish Kumar the Bihar CM, five times. RJD made him the CM twice, we did that five times. We had a relation for 17 years. But you severed ties (with us) twice," he added.

89.title: After Lokesh finishes film with Vijay, we'll start 'Kaithi 2': Karthi
89.article_body: Actor Karthi has confirmed that they will begin with the sequel to the 2019 film 'Kaithi' by next year. "'Kaithi 2'...we are planning for next year. After Lokesh Kanagaraj (director) finishes his film with Vijay, we will start 'Kaithi 2'," he stated. Karthi will next be seen in 'Ponniyin Selvan-1', which also features actor Vikram and actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

90.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava suffers heart attack while working out at gym
90.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava suffered a heart attack while working out at a gym in New Delhi on Wednesday morning. His team confirmed the news to The Indian Express, saying, "Raju sir suffered a mild heart attack while working out. He is admitted to AIIMS, but he is doing fine." Srivastava reportedly collapsed while running on a treadmill.

91.title: CWG medals just the beginning for our wrestlers: Indian women's coach Jitendra
91.article_body: Indian women's wrestling coach Jitendra Yadav has said the six medals in women's wrestling at CWG 2022 is just the beginning and their "real test" will be at the World Championships, which will begin on September 10. "Our wrestlers could've won more gold medals if they were more disciplined," he added. Sakshi Malik and Vinesh Phogat bagged gold medals.

92.title: Mumbai Metro 3 project cost surges 44% to ₹33405.82 crore: Report
92.article_body: The Maharashtra Cabinet will approve 44% hike in cost of Mumbai's Colaba-Seepz Metro-3 project, taking the total cost of the project to ₹33,405.82 crore from ₹23,316 crore, which is a jump of over ₹10,269.82 crore, reported FPJ. The increase in cost is due to several reasons including the time taken in excavation owing to presence of basalt rock, report said.

93.title: Nitish Kumar's politics is around non-Congressism, Is that finished?: RS Prasad
93.article_body: After Nitish Kumar ended the alliance with BJP and resigned as Bihar CM, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad on Wednesday said Kumar has been a "non-Congress" leader. "His politics is around non-Congressism. Is that finished?" Prasad asked. "Compromise with corruption and non-Congressism. Nitish Kumar sided with corruption and Congressism. Congratulations," Prasad stated.

94.title: 6 rape, 7 molestation cases every day this year in Delhi: Police data
94.article_body: Delhi Police data have revealed that the national capital has witnessed at least six rape and seven molestation cases every day so far in 2022. More than 1,100 rape cases have been registered in Delhi so far this year. As many as 1,480 cases of molestation and assault were registered from January to July 15, as per police data.

95.title: St Xavier's University took printouts of my swimsuit pics without consent: Former professor
95.article_body: A former assistant professor at St Xavier's University, Kolkata, who was allegedly forced to resign over her swimsuit photos, has said that a university committee took printouts of her photos without her consent. She said they showed her the photos and asked her if it was her and how it would affect the students. "They did witch hunt," she added.

96.title: UK woman left with 'lizard neck' after procedure to fix her double chin goes wrong
96.article_body: A UK woman who went for a procedure to fix her double chin ended up with red dots all over her neck. "I had hundreds of brown dots all over my chest. I looked like a lizard," Jayne Bowman said. The 59-year-old went for a non-surgical skin-tightening treatment called plasma fibroblast therapy.

97.title: He commanded respect from one and all: Sachin Tendulkar on Koertzen
97.article_body: Paying tribute to former umpire Rudi Koertzen, who passed away aged 73, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "I first met Rudi in 1992...He was a warm-hearted person who always greeted players with a big smile." "He commanded respect from one and all," added Tendulkar. Virender Sehwag had earlier tweeted that Rudi would "scold" him in case he played a rash shot.

98.title: I get a lot of abuse on social media, have to think before posting: Big B
98.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan opened up about being trolled on social media on the show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14'. He said he gets many abusive comments after he posts a picture or writes anything on social media. "They write, 'who do you think you are'...One needs to think...before writing. I have to think a lot before posting anything," he added.

99.title: Biden not briefed on FBI raid at Trump's Florida home: White House
99.article_body: US President Joe Biden "wasn't briefed" or given advance notice about the FBI raid on ex-President Donald Trump's Florida home, White House said. "The President and White House learned about this FBI search from public reports...just like the American people did," White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said. She also stressed the Justice Department conducts investigations independently.

100.title: Delhivery's June revenue drops 16% after sales dip amid inflation
100.article_body: Logistics unicorn Delhivery's revenue from operations has dropped 16% in the June quarter, as compared to the March quarter. The revenue has slipped to ₹1,746 crore at a time when the e-commerce industry saw a dip in sales amid rising inflation. The Gurugram-based company offers services in 17,045 PIN codes in the country out of total 19,300.

101.title: Buying real estate in metaverse is the dumbest shit ever: Mark Cuban
101.article_body: Billionaire investor and Shark Tank judge Mark Cuban while speaking to a cryptocurrency YouTube channel remarked that people buying real estate in the metaverse is the "dumbest shit ever". Cuban further said, "Did I say dumb? No, that is not strong enough. It is super-mega immaculately dumb...It is not even as good as a URL."

102.title: My films that performed the worst weren't female-centric: Vidya Balan
102.article_body: Vidya Balan, speaking about her initial days, said she was made to feel like she was making unconventional film choices. "I wondered if I had to look at a different kind of film...I wasn't seeing success because I wasn't doing the...conventional films," she said. "Amongst all the films...I did...the ones that weren't female-centric films performed the worst," she added.

103.title: Fintech startup Jodo raises $15 mn in Tiger Global-led Series A round
103.article_body: Jodo, a Bengaluru-based fintech startup, raised $15 million in a Series A round led by Tiger Global. Existing investors, Elevation Capital and Matrix Partners India, also participated in the funding. Tiger Global will hold around 11% stake, while the other two will together hold 13%. Jodo focuses on the private education sector, enabling parents to plan their children's education fees.

104.title: Once you've invested in youngsters, you can't leave them to be barbecued: Karim
104.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has supported the selection of Avesh Khan ahead of Mohammad Shami for the upcoming Asia Cup. "I feel once you have invested in youngsters like Avesh Khan, you possibly can't leave them out to be barbecued," he stated. Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan are the only pacers in the squad.

105.title: Ukraine war must end with liberation of Crimea: Prez Zelenskyy
105.article_body: The war in Ukraine began with Crimea and must end with its liberation, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. "Russia has turned our peninsula, which has always been...one of the best places in Europe, into one of the most dangerous places," he added. Zelenskyy's comments came hours after a string of explosions hit a Russian airbase in Crimea, killing one person.

106.title: Awareness against PM Modi spreading among people of country: RJD leader
106.article_body: RJD National General Secretary Shyam Rajak on Wednesday said, "Awareness against PM Narendra Modi is spreading among the people of the country." His statement came amid ongoing Bihar political crisis. "More than 10 lakh people would be employed...There is a flicker of hope for the people who have been concerned about the growing communalism," he added.

107.title: You only have to say 'Yes sir', implement whatever ministers say: Gadkari to bureaucrats
107.article_body: Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has said, "I always tell the officers (bureaucrats), that the government will not work according to what you say." "You only have to say 'Yes sir'. You have to implement whatever we (ministers) are saying, government will work according to us," Gadkari further said.

108.title: Bhima-Koregaon accused Varavara Rao gets regular bail on medical grounds
108.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday granted regular bail to activist and poet Varavara Rao, an accused in the 2018 Bhima-Koregaon case, "purely on medical grounds". Rao shall not leave the jurisdiction of the concerned trial court without permission, SC directed. He shall not misuse his liberty and he shall not be in touch with any witnesses, SC further said.

109.title: IMD issues orange alert for Pune, 4 other Maha districts for Wednesday
109.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an 'orange' alert for Pune, Satara, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Palghar districts for Wednesday, stating that heavy rainfall is likely over parts of central Maharashtra and Vidarbha. It has also issued a 'yellow' alert for the five districts for Thursday. Pune recorded 23.2 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours, IMD said on Wednesday.

110.title: WazirX trading volume declines by over 54% amid ownership controversy, ED probe
110.article_body: WazirX, which has been in a clash with Binance over its ownership and is facing a probe by the Enforcement Directorate, has seen its trading volume decline by over 54% over the last five days. Last year, it traded a volume of $43 billion. Meanwhile, WazirX also requested users to not panic and assured them of their funds' safety.

111.title: It's 'ghar wapasi' of 2017-2020 mandate: Manoj Jha on RJD-JD(U) alliance
111.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha reacted to his party's decision to form government in Bihar in alliance with JD(U) and said, "It's not only a government that'll take oath, it's 'ghar wapasi' of 2017-2020 mandate." "It's very important, especially in an era where BJP has decided to mangle democratic values - that only they would remain," Jha said.

112.title: Do you have any ideology?: Chirag Paswan asks Nitish Kumar
112.article_body: Amid ongoing political situation in Bihar, LJP’s National President Chirag Paswan said Nitish Kumar, who resigned as CM of Bihar, has once again insulted the people’s mandate. "Is it a joke? At one time you go with somebody...other time with someone else…Do you have any ideology or not?" Paswan asked. "JD(U) will get zero seats in next election," he stated.

113.title: 4in1 flu vaccination can help protect children from H1N1: Experts
113.article_body: Recent reports suggest a rising trend in Swine Flu (H1N1) cases in cities across India. Children younger than 5 years in age are at up to 7 times higher risk of getting hospitalised. "Pediatricians advise 4in1 flu vaccination annually along with good hand hygiene and social distancing for children from 6 months to 5 years," said Dr Upendra Kinjawadekar.

114.title: If any girl tells a boy she wants to have sex, she is doing 'dhanda': Mukesh Khanna
114.article_body: Actor Mukesh Khanna is being criticised for his comments in a video on his YouTube channel, where he said, "If any girl tells a boy that she wants to have sex with him, then she is not a girl, she is doing 'dhanda' (business)." He added, "Because a decent girl belonging to a civilised society would never say such things."

115.title: Was told you're not a woman enough if you're not voluptuous: Sonali
115.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre revealed that she was body-shamed for being skinny in the 90s. "Being skinny was definitely not the standard of beauty, so voluptuousness was the standard of beauty," she said. Sonali added, "I was told you were just not a woman enough if you were not voluptuous, you know which it shouldn't be."

116.title: Partha said he will write about his life in prison, sought pen and paper: Official
116.article_body: Ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested in alleged job scam case, sought paper and a pen on Monday saying he will write about his life, officials said. Chatterjee has also requested for a few books on politics, economics, and law and he is being provided newspapers but he has so far shown no interest in it, the officials added.

117.title: I am the 'most nepotistic' filmmaker in India: Anurag Kashyap
117.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, who's directed movies like 'Black Friday', 'Bombay Talkies' as well as the 'Gangs of Wasseypur' film franchise said he is the "most nepotistic" filmmaker in India. "I need to know my people because I trust them...I won't hire somebody...I don't know," added Anurag. Actress Kangana Ranaut had earlier termed director Karan Johar as the flag-bearer of nepotism.

118.title: If I've hurt anyone, I regret it: Aamir Khan on boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' trend
118.article_body: Speaking on the controversy around his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and calls on social media to boycott it, actor Aamir Khan on Tuesday said, "If I have hurt anyone by any means, I regret it." He added, "I don't want to hurt anyone. If someone doesn't want to watch the film, I'd respect their sentiment."

119.title: Users registered only after completion of KYC: WazirX in statement amid ED probe
119.article_body: WazirX on behalf of its parent company Zanmai Labs released a statement amid a clash with Binance and ED freezing its assets. It said, "Users are signed up on WazirX...after they complete the KYC process...ED appears to be investigating the transactions of certain users...Zanmai Labs...has no affiliation with such users and is unaware of the purpose of their transactions."

120.title: I can't even say the word 'relationship' well, how can I be in one?: Vijay
120.article_body: After actress Sara Ali Khan recently expressed her desire to date actor Vijay Deverakonda, the actor said, "I can't even say the word 'relationship' well. How can I be in one?" "I texted Sara. It's...sweet of her to have said that," added Vijay. "I love how you say 'Deverakonda'. Cutest," Vijay had earlier reacted to Sara's statement on Instagram.

121.title: Lenovo reports slowest revenue growth in 9 quarters
121.article_body: China's Lenovo Group has reported flat revenue for the April to June quarter, its lowest result in nine quarters. The world's biggest maker of personal computers reported the slowest revenue growth when a number of Chinese cities faced COVID-19 lockdowns. During the period, total revenue was $16.96 billion, up 0.2% from the same quarter a year ago.

122.title: Roblox shares fall 15% as company posts lower net bookings in Q2
122.article_body: Online gaming platform Roblox Corporation posted lower net bookings of $639.9 million in the second quarter as against $665.5 million in the year-ago period amid reports of the online gaming industry facing a slump as the COVID-19 pandemic restrictions are easing. Roblox shares fell 15% in after-hours trading on Tuesday and its stock's value has declined over 50% this year.

123.title: Intel & PC manufacturers partner to co-engineer premium laptops
123.article_body: Intel announced its partnership with the top PC manufacturers to co-engineer a line-up of premium thin, light, & stylish Intel®️ Evo™️ laptops. As per Intel, these laptops deliver premium features including instant wake, nearly 3X faster Wi-Fi speeds, fast-charging, long-lasting battery, and intelligent collaboration features like dynamic noise cancellation. Find more details on www.intel.com/evo

124.title: Egyptian singer with two wives and 4 children proposed me: Urvashi Rautela
124.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela in an interview said, "I have dealt with so many proposals. But there was one which came from someone, which could have led to a lot of cultural differences." She revealed that an Egyptian singer who has two wives and four children had proposed her. Urvashi further said that she had met the singer in Dubai.

125.title: No CNG sale in Delhi today over non-reimbursement of electricity bills of pumps
125.article_body: Delhi Petrol Dealers Association said that there will not be any CNG sale in the city on Wednesday and CNG pumps will be closed from 6 am to 10 pm. It has called for a protest against the non-reimbursement of electricity bills of CNG pumps by Indraprastha Gas Limited. The non-reimbursement is causing huge losses every day, pump dealers said.

126.title: No 'Operation Lotus' in Bihar, all done in civilised & low-cost way: Jairam
126.article_body: Congress’ Jairam Ramesh reacted to the political situation in Bihar saying, "Bihar was no 'Operation Lotus'." "No cash caught. No ED raids. No Assam CM. No resort travel. All done in characteristic Bihar style, civilised and low-cost," Ramesh tweeted. "CM gets support of largest party...In Maharashtra, BJP engineered defections. In Bihar, BJP was rejected and ejected," he added.

127.title: Cuba's worst ever fire brought under control after burning for 5 days
127.article_body: A fire that destroyed Cuba's main fuel storage facility in Matanzas has been brought under control after five days. About 40% of the facility has been destroyed in what officials said was the worst fire in its history. The fire, which also caused massive blackouts, was triggered when lightning struck one of the tanks at the storage facility last Friday.

128.title: Punjab and Haryana HC grants bail to SAD's Bikram Majithia in NDPS case
128.article_body: Punjab and Haryana HC has granted bail to Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) MLA Bikram Singh Majithia in a case registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985. The present case is "blatantly political in nature", Majithia told HC in his bail plea. This comes after the Supreme Court on May 11 refused to entertain the bail plea.

129.title: Serena is at the same level as Michael Jordan, LeBron James: McEnroe
129.article_body: Reacting to 23-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams announcing her retirement from tennis, ex-world number one tennis player John McEnroe said Serena is at the same level as Michael Jordan and LeBron James. "She's...one of the...greatest athletes in the history of any sport," he added. "Anyone that saw...'King Richard'...realises...where she's now is unbelievable," stated McEnroe.

130.title: We're living in strange times; 2 yrs later, Sushant trends every day: Kashyap
130.article_body: Anurag Kashyap opened up about the boycott culture and said these are strange times, where everything is to be boycotted. "We are living in very strange times. Two years later, Sushant Singh Rajput still trends every day," Kashyap added. The filmmaker further said India has a boycott culture now and added, "If you're not being boycotted, then you don't matter."

131.title: Thinking too much about 24th Slam didn't help: Serena Williams
131.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has said that thinking "too much" about surpassing Margaret Court's all-time record of 24 Grand Slam titles didn't help her. "I'd be lying if I said I didn't want that record," she added. Serena has announced that she will retire from tennis following US Open 2022.

132.title: I never let this 'Oh God, I'm playing only one format' feeling inside: Dhawan
132.article_body: Talking about his current role in Team India, Shikhar Dhawan has said, "Till the time I'm playing for India, I'd like to be an asset and not a liability." He added, "I never let this feeling creep into my system that, 'Oh God, I'm playing only one format'...If I'm playing...after a gap...it always gives me a chance to remain fresh."

133.title: Monkeys under attack in Brazil amid rising monkeypox cases
133.article_body: The World Health Organization decried increasing attacks on monkeys in Brazil amid a rise in monkeypox cases. "What people need to know is that...transmission we're seeing is happening between humans," WHO's spokeswoman Margaret Harris said. This comes after Brazilian news website, G1, on Sunday reported that around 10 monkeys were poisoned in less than a week in Sao Paulo state.

134.title: 51-yr-old Afghan charged in killing of 2 Muslim men in US' Albuquerque
134.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Afghanistan has been charged with the murders of two Muslim men in US' Albuquerque and has been identified as a prime suspect in other killings. The exact nature of the relationship between Muhammad Syed and victims remains unknown. Police said it has not been ascertained whether the deaths are hate crimes or serial killings or both.

135.title: Bill to give Afghans path to citizenship introduced in US Congress
135.article_body: Bipartisan legislation has been introduced in both houses of US Congress which aims to pave the path for Afghan evacuees in the US to gain American citizenship. As many as 76,000 Afghans evacuated in last year's operation entered the US on humanitarian parole. The bill also aims to extend Special Immigration Visas (SIV) to women who served in counterterrorism teams.

136.title: Oil prices fall after data shows US crude inventories rising
136.article_body: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after industry data showed that US crude inventories had risen by about 2.2 million barrels for the week ended August 5. Brent crude futures declined by 6 cents to $96.25 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures fell by 16 cents to $90.34 a barrel. On Tuesday, oil prices settled slightly lower.

137.title: We fixed it: Twitter rolls back internal systems change after partial outage
137.article_body: After thousands of users reported an outage of Twitter on Tuesday, the company on Wednesday announced that the issue was fixed and that it had "made an internal systems change that didn't go as planned". According to Downdetector, users began facing issues around 2 pm EDT on Tuesday (around 11:30 pm in India).

138.title: Man out on bail in molestation case shoots victim's father dead in UP
138.article_body: A 21-year-old man, out on bail in a molestation case, allegedly shot dead the victim's father in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur, police said. The man, along with his father, uncle and a friend have been booked. He was arrested in 2021 after a 17-year-old girl had alleged he had sexually assaulted her when she was alone in her house, police added.

139.title: It's making my life easier: Vijay on wearing slippers to promote 'Liger'
139.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda opened up about wearing slippers during the promotions of his film 'Liger'. "See, 30 days I have to promote the film and then every day I have to look for shoes and clothes and it will take forever," he said. He added that he has bought "great" slippers and it is making his life easier.

140.title: US-based firm FCTRY raises $120,000 to make Zelenskyy action figure
140.article_body: US-based product design company FCTRY will make an action figure of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The company launched a campaign to fund production and reached its $30,000 goal in three hours and has so far raised over $120,000. A Seattle-based artist moulded 6-inch tall clay prototype of the action figure and its plastic version will be mass produced in China.

141.title: Microsoft to mark 15 years OneDrive with new features, design
141.article_body: To mark OneDrive's 15th anniversary, Microsoft has come up with a new landing page called OneDrive Home. It contains a list of user files, organised according to how recently they were accessed, which is quite similar to the online version of the Office. The Verge has quoted Microsoft as saying that OneDrive Home would be available in "the coming months".

142.title: One leader can't face all challenges before this country: RSS chief
142.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said that one leader cannot face all the challenges before this country and a single organisation or party cannot bring about change. "Change takes place when the common man stands up for it," Bhagwat added. "All things take place through a change in society and the RSS is organising society," he stated.

143.title: BMC to widen drains in Andheri subway to avoid waterlogging
143.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken a project of widening drains at Andheri (West) at an estimated cost of ₹100 crore, which will take 18 months to complete. "The stormwater drain on the western side is not enough to take more quantity of water at a time. So with each rain, the subway gets flooded," a BMC official said.

144.title: This is what Bihar has done: RJD on PM Modi's 2017 tweet on state
144.article_body: RJD, which formed an alliance with JD(U), after Nitish Kumar broke his ties with BJP, shared PM Modi's 2017 tweet on Bihar in which he said that the state needs to fight against corruption for country's bright future. Sharing PM's tweet, RJD wrote, "Yes sir, this is exactly what Bihar has done...This is the demand of the country today."

145.title: Alia is a brave actress, chose to embrace motherhood at young age: Kareena
145.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan was asked if she has advice for Alia Bhatt facing comments on her pregnancy. To this, she replied that Alia doesn't need advice and added the 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' actress is the finest actress of the decade. "For her to be embracing motherhood, you know, at such a young age...She is such a brave actress," Kareena added.

146.title: We play a lot of cricket, so we want to create our bench strength: Rohit
146.article_body: Talking about frequent changes in India's squads, captain Rohit Sharma said they are trying to create their bench strength to make sure that the team's future is in "safe hands". "We play lot of cricket, so there will be injuries and workload management...But it gives our bench strength to go and play the game," added Rohit.

147.title: Use public transport: B'luru Traffic Police to Lalbagh Flower Show visitors
147.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police urged the visitors to Lalbagh Botanical Garden's Independence Day Flower Show to use public transport. "There is a metro station in Lalbagh west gate...a BMTC bus stand at Lalbagh main gate. Shantinagar bus stand and Siddapura bus stand are also available for commuters," police said. Lalbagh Flower Show is being held from August 5 to August 15.

148.title: TMC won't be in power in West Bengal by December: Suvendu Adhikari
148.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday claimed that the TMC government will "cease to exist" by December in West Bengal. "Wait for a few months...Mark my words, by December this year, TMC will not be in power in West Bengal. The Assembly poll and parliamentary elections will be held simultaneously in 2024 in West Bengal," Adhikari added.

149.title: New Zealand cricketer Trent Boult gives up his central contract
149.article_body: New Zealand cricketer Trent Boult, the current world number one ODI bowler, has given up his central contract. "Ultimately...this decision is about my wife Gert and our three young boys," the 33-year-old said. "I still have a big desire to represent my country...However, I respect the fact that not having a national contract will affect my selection chances," he added.

150.title: India reports 16,047 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 26% more than yesterday
150.article_body: India has reported 16,047 new COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours, including six reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,28,261, while the daily positivity rate went up to 4.94%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,826.

151.title: 42-yr-old mother, 24-yr-old son clear Kerala Public Service Commission exam
151.article_body: A 42-year-old woman named Bindu and her 24-year-old son have cleared Kerala Public Service Commission (PSC) examination together. Bindu cleared the Last Grade Servants (LGS) exam with a rank of 92, and Vivek cleared the Lower Divisional Clerk (LDC) exam with a rank of 38, PTI reported. "We both studied together but never thought that we'll qualify together," said Vivek.

152.title: iRobot announced 10% job cuts the same day as Amazon declared firm's acquisition
152.article_body: The day Amazon announced its acquisition of iRobot for about $1.7 billion, the latter revealed its plans to cut 140 jobs, nearly 10% of its workforce. The disclosure was made in its quarterly earnings report. Meanwhile, iRobot also clarified that the layoffs were not a result of the Amazon deal and that the latter was not involved in this decision.

153.title: Sold Tesla shares to avoid emergency sale if Twitter forces deal closure: Musk
153.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 7.92 million shares of Tesla worth around $6.9 billion. Tweeting about this, he wrote, "In the (hopefully unlikely) event that Twitter forces this deal to close and some equity partners don't come through, it is important to avoid an emergency sale of Tesla stock." Notably, he sold Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion in April.

154.title: Karthik will be 'very unhappy' with his dismissal: Ojha on 5th T20I vs WI
154.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik will be "very unhappy" with himself, following his dismissal in the fifth T20I against West Indies. "When you can score with a straight bat, why do you have to try something like this? It was such a good chance for him," added Ojha. Karthik was dismissed for 12 runs off 9 balls.

155.title: Sensex jumps 10 points to 58,863, Nifty crosses 17,500 in opening trade
155.article_body: Benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Wednesday with Sensex and Nifty surging 10.92 points and 7.90 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,863.99 points and Nifty at 17,533. Nestle India, Sun Pharma, Bharti Airtel and Power Grid Corp were among the major gainers on the BSE Sensex, while ITC, HDFC Bank, Asian Paints, Axis Bank and Titan slipped.

156.title: What is the Langya virus that has been detected in China?
156.article_body: The Langya virus, which has been detected in China, was predominantly found in small mole-like mammals called shrews, according to a study in The New England Journal of Medicine. It was detected during surveillance of patients with a recent history of animal exposure. According to the study, patients with pneumonia had higher viral loads than those without pneumonia.

157.title: ODI cricket is an art and still has the charm, I love playing it: Dhawan
157.article_body: Amid talks over the future of ODI cricket, Team India batter Shikhar Dhawan has said the format is an art and still has the charm. "Like Test and T20 have their values, ODI cricket is also exciting. I really like it," he added. Several cricketers including Ravichandran Ashwin, Moeen Ali and Wasim Akram have questioned the relevance of ODIs.

158.title: BJP never betrays, destabilising state govts is to bring stability: Chidambaram
158.article_body: BJP never betrays the people of any state, destabilising state governments is to bring stability to governance in those states, Congress’ P Chidambaram said on Tuesday. His remark came amid the political situation in Bihar. "Encouraging defections from other parties is a welfare measure for upliftment of defectors. Breaking other political parties is to purify those parties," Chidambaram tweeted.

159.title: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi tests positive for COVID-19
159.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has tested positive for COVID-19. "Tested positive for COVID-19 (again!) today. Will be isolating at home and following all protocols," she tweeted on Wednesday morning. This is the second time that she has tested positive for COVID-19. Priyanka had earlier tested COVID-19 positive in June this year.

160.title: How can Ashwin be part of Asia Cup squad? I am surprised: Kiran More
160.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More said he is "surprised" to see spinner Ravichandran Ashwin being included in the squad for Asia Cup 2022. "How can Ashwin even come in this team? And every time. Even in the last World Cup he was picked in the team and...did not play. Look at his IPL record, it is not that good," added More.

161.title: Nitish let go of his 'niti' and 'niyat' due to his PM ambitions: BJP's Giriraj
161.article_body: BJP leader Giriraj Singh criticised JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar for breaking alliance with the BJP and said that Nitish has let go of 'niti' and 'niyat' for his PM ambitions. "BJP gave birth to Nitish Kumar. He (Nitish) cannot fight an election on his own", Singh added. Singh also called Nitish Kumar 'palturam' (turncoat).

162.title: If BJP allowed to become stronger, people may lose voting rights: Akhilesh
162.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that if BJP is allowed to become stronger, people may lose their voting rights. "Is there any election in the neighbouring country of China? If you go beyond, are there any elections in Russia?" he added. "Your employment is being taken away and the Constitution is also being attacked," Akhilesh further said.

163.title: Facebook parent Meta raises $10 billion in its first-ever bond offering
163.article_body: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has raised $10 billion in its first-ever bond offering as the company looks to fund share buybacks and investments to revamp its business. Apart from Meta, Apple and Intel had also issued bonds recently, raising $5.5 billion and $6 billion, respectively. In July, Meta had reported its first-ever quarterly drop in revenue.

164.title: Musk sells nearly $7 billion worth of Tesla shares, first time since April
164.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 7.92 million Tesla shares worth $6.9 billion, as per regulatory filings. This reportedly leaves him with a 15% stake in the company. In April, Musk sold Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion while he lined up financing for the $44 billion Twitter deal and said he had no further plans to sell the company's shares.

165.title: Was my call; I have a body, so show it: Vijay on 'Liger' nude poster
165.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, speaking about the nude poster of 'Liger', said it was "completely" his call. He added that Karan Johar and the team were hesitant at first, however, they later agreed to do it. "I just get some ideas in my head...if I get excited by it, I do it...I have a body, so show it," he said.

166.title: Burglars drill hole in wall, steal liquor bottles worth ₹12 lakh in Pune
166.article_body: Pune Police said some suspected burglars drilled a hole in the wall of a warehouse on Saswad Road and stole 120 boxes containing liquor bottles along with digital recorder of CCTV cameras worth ₹12.65 lakh. FIR was registered at Hadapsar Police Station on Monday. Earlier, some burglars drilled a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri.

167.title: EV charging and biodiesel filling stations launched at Hyderabad airport
167.article_body: Electric vehicle charging points have been launched at the main car park and a biodiesel filling station at the public transportation centre (PTC) in Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The charging stations, which have the capacity to charge a four-wheeler from empty to full in just one hour, can be used by all EV users, a press release said.

168.title: She's like my sister: Politician Shrikant Tyagi arrested for assaulting Noida woman
168.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police for allegedly abusing and assaulting a woman in Noida, on Tuesday said, "I express my regret on the incident. She is like my sister, the incident is political and was done to politically decimate me." Surajpur court sent Tyagi to 14-day judicial custody. His three associates were also arrested.

169.title: Egyptian singer with 2 wives & 4 children had proposed me: Urvashi Rautela
169.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela has revealed that an Egyptian singer, who had two wives and four children, had proposed to her. "I did not want to take such a decision, where I have to go and live so far, or he has to live here," she added. 'Sanam Re' actress, however, did not mention the name of the Egyptian singer.

170.title: Actress Ridhi Dogra responds after trolls blame her for Shamita, Raqesh Bapat's breakup
170.article_body: Actress Ridhi Dogra has responded after trolls blamed her for Shamita Shetty and Raqesh Bapat's breakup. "But this entire situation that I am being constantly being pulled into is not even being remotely my circus," she wrote. "If beating me down helps you channelize your hurt I'm happy to help. Carry on and god bless you all," she added.

171.title: Mumbai Police to launch initiative to reunite missing children with families
171.article_body: The Mumbai Police will launch 'Operation Reunited', an initiative to reunite missing or abducted children with their families. The 'Operation Reunited' will start from August 15 (Independence Day) and go on till September 15, an official said. The police have also appealed to people to inform them on helpline numbers 100 or 1098 about children found in suspicious conditions.

172.title: 16 of 26 sewage plants in Delhi do not meet quality parameters: Study
172.article_body: A Delhi Pollution Control Committee report has found that 16 of 26 sewage treatment plants in the national capital do not meet the Central Pollution Control Board's quality parameters. Nilothi, Najafgarh and New Kondli plants have been found to be the worst performers, breaching the standards set for each parameter by two to six times, the report added.

173.title: Expanding Delhi sewage system crucial to clean Yamuna: Jal Board
173.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has said that expanding the sewage system in the city is crucial to cleaning the Yamuna. The Delhi government had announced that it would clean the river by 2025 and the Jal Board has constructed 24 weirs and check-dams on the Najafgarh drain as part of the project. The Board held a review meeting on Monday.

174.title: F1 driver Ricciardo wants $21-million payout to leave McLaren: Reports
174.article_body: F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo wants a $21-million payout to end his multi-year contract with the McLaren F1 team at the end of 2022, reports said. This comes as various reports claimed McLaren want to replace Ricciardo with F2 champion Oscar Piastri. Ricciardo, an eight-time F1 race winner, joined McLaren at the start of the 2021 season on a three-year contract.

175.title: Tiger Woods motivated me to play tennis again: Serena Williams
175.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams revealed that it was golfer Tiger Woods who motivated her to play tennis again after she was sidelined for a year due to injury. She said she spoke to her "friend" Woods, who told her to try getting back to the sport in "short spurts". Serena spoke of this while announcing her retirement.

176.title: Former Real Madrid midfielder Isco joins Sevilla on a free transfer
176.article_body: After nine years of playing for Real Madrid, Spanish midfielder Isco has joined their La Liga rivals, Sevilla.
