The 30-year-old free agent signed a two-year contract with the team that will start their league campaign at Osasuna on Friday. Current Sevilla manager Julen Lopetegui has earlier coached the attacking midfielder in Real Madrid and the Spanish national team.

177.title: Shake It Off lyrics were written by me: Swift on plagiarism lawsuit
177.article_body: Singer Taylor Swift responded to the plagiarism lawsuit against her song 'Shake It Off'. The singer said, "The lyrics to ‘Shake It Off’ were written entirely by me." Taylor was sued by 'Playas Gon' Play' songwriters for her song's chorus. In her declaration, she said she never heard 'Playas Gon' Play' song or of the group 3LW before the claim.

178.title: US' Antony Blinken meets South African Prez as part of Africa tour
178.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met South African President Cyril Ramaphosa at an airforce base in Centurion on Tuesday. Blinken, who is on a three-nation tour of Africa, later left for Congo. In his South Africa visit, Blinken launched the US' engagement policy with sub-Saharan African countries, calling the region a "major geopolitical force".

179.title: Israeli troops kill 3 Palestinian militants in occupied West Bank
179.article_body: Israeli forces killed three Palestinian militants and injured dozens in a shootout during an arrest raid in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday. The Israeli military said troops were attacked by Palestinians throwing stones and explosives at them and that the soldiers retaliated with live fire. The shootout follows intense clashes over the weekend in the Gaza Strip.

180.title: Alleged terrorist planning attack on Independence Day arrested in UP
180.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested an alleged terrorist with ties to the Islamic State on Tuesday after interrogating him in Lucknow. Sabauddin Azmi was planning an attack on Independence Day, an official said. An illegal weapon and materials to make bombs were seized from him, he said. Azmi was booked under sections of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and Arms Act.

181.title: 1-year-old boy missing after falling into open drain in Punjab
181.article_body: A year-old boy fell into an open drain in Punjab's Kapurthala on Tuesday and rescue operations are on to save him, police said. The boy Abhilash and his four-year-old sister were crossing the drain by walking over a cement pole kept on it, when he slipped and fell. The boy's mother jumped into the drain but failed to find him.

182.title: Ukrainian guerrillas threaten Russian control in occupied regions
182.article_body: Russia's plan to hold referendums in regions under its control in southeast Ukraine has been threatened by guerrilla forces loyal to Kyiv, Associated Press reported on Tuesday. The resistance against Kremlin has killed pro-Moscow officials and destroyed trains and bridges being used by Russia for supplies. Further, the guerrilla forces have helped the Ukrainian military by locating key targets.

183.title: Assam Rifles officer injured as gunmen open fire in Arunachal
183.article_body: A Junior Commissioned Officer of Assam Rifles was injured after suspected militants opened fire at a patrolling team near the India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh on Tuesday. Troops were undertaking enhanced patrolling ahead of Independence Day when the shooting occurred from across the border, an official said. ULFA (I) and NSCN (K-YA) are suspected to have carried out the attack.

184.title: Rockets fired by Gaza militants killed 14 Palestinians: Israel
184.article_body: At least 14 Palestinians were killed by rockets fired by militants of Gaza as it clashed with Israeli forces over the weekend, the Israeli military has said. In the attacks, 47 Palestinians were killed, Israel said, claiming 200 rockets fired by the militants fell in Palestinian territory. Israel claimed victory over the clashes saying it killed two Islamic Jihad commanders.

185.title: Punjab logs 406 fresh COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths reported
185.article_body: Punjab reported 406 new cases of COVID-19 and seven deaths due to the infection on Tuesday, a medical bulletin said. Tuesday's fresh cases took the state's active case tally to 2,841, news agency PTI reported. According to the bulletin, two of the seven fatalities recorded in the state were from Mohali. Barnala, Jalandhar, Ludhiana and Rupnagar reported one death each.

186.title: National flags worth ₹16 cr sold in Assam ahead of Independence Day
186.article_body: National flags worth ₹16.07 crore have been sold in Assam so far ahead of Independence Day and 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Over 53 lakh Tiranga have been sold [in Assam]...20 lakh from Fair Price Shops and 33 lakh from [Assam State Rural Livelihood Mission]." Self-help groups have stitched 35,95,167 national flags in Assam.

187.title: 37 arrested in raid by anti-narcotics team of police in Shillong
187.article_body: Anti-narcotics team of police in Shillong conducted a raid in the city's Polo Bazar area on Tuesday and arrested 37 individuals, 27 of whom were drug users, an official informed. Banned substances including heroin weighing 8.97 gm, 20 nitrazepam tablets and 286.93 gm of cannabis were seized during the raids, the official added.

188.title: Films are meant to spread love, not meant to be cancelled: Kareena
188.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said the cancel and boycott culture "upsets" and "saddens" her. Talking about the efforts that went behind making 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Kareena said films are meant "to spread love and positivity". She added, "It's not meant to kind of be cancelled or spoken about in that sense and it upsets me."

189.title: Considered hypnotherapy to forget Lord of the Rings trilogy: Director
189.article_body: 'Lord of the Rings' (LOTR) director Peter Jackson called himself an "unlucky person" as he couldn’t enjoy the trilogy like an audience member. He said he "did seriously consider" hypnotherapy as he wished to forget the films and his years of work on them to be able to enjoy them. However, he admitted he didn't go through with the plan.

190.title: What is the issue: Chopra questions India picking 3 pacers for Asia Cup
190.article_body: After only three full-time pacers were named in the Indian squad for the upcoming Asia Cup tournament, former cricketer Aakash Chopra questioned the move by saying, "What is the issue?" "There is a lot of grass on the [Dubai] pitch...There is consistent help for the fast bowlers. We saw that in the IPL," Chopra said.

191.title: I've never set out to play these many games: Pollard on playing 600 T20s
191.article_body: Commenting on becoming the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history, West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard said, "It's an achievement in itself, 600 games in any format." He added, "I've never set out to play these many games." Pollard achieved this feat while playing for London Spirit at the ongoing The Hundred tournament at Lord's on Monday.

192.title: 3 suspected members of militant group NNC arrested in Assam
192.article_body: Three suspected militants of the Naga National Council (NNC) have been arrested from Assam's Cachar district over the last 24 hours, police said on Tuesday. Two of the three suspects were arrested from Shib Colony area of Silchar town on Monday, police added. On the basis of information provided by them, the third individual was arrested from Jirighat area.

193.title: Filled with gratitude on another CWG: Sharath on 4 medals in Birmingham
193.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal said he's filled with gratitude and happiness on his participation in another Commonwealth Games. He added that CWG 2022 was his best one. The 40-year-old won four medals, including three golds, in Birmingham. Sharath made his debut at CWG 2006 in Melbourne. Sharath and boxer Nikhat Zareen were the flag-bearers at the closing ceremony.

194.title: Now our govt is formed; everyone will get employment: RJD's Tej Pratap
194.article_body: After JD(U) broke its alliance with BJP on Tuesday, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav said that "now our government has been formed, everyone will get employment". "Now everything is up to the people, if the people want, they will get rid of BJP's fever in 2 minutes. We will accept whatever we get," Yadav said.

195.title: MS Dhoni said 'Fielding and running between wickets are non-negotiable for me': R Sridhar
195.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni's captaincy style, former India fielding coach R Sridhar said, "MS...when he was captain, he led the fielding. And the running between the wickets was to me, an eye opener." He added, "MS said, 'Two things that are non-negotiable for me are fielding and running between the wickets'. And that is something which still holds true."

196.title: Female tourist dies after drowning in sea in Odisha's Puri
196.article_body: A female tourist died from drowning on Tuesday in Odisha's Puri after a strong wave swept away three friends taking a bath in the sea. The woman was declared dead when she was taken to a hospital after being pulled out of the sea. The incident took place around 11 am near the Digabareni area of Blue Flag beach.

197.title: Stones hurled during Muharram procession in UP after row over DJ
197.article_body: Members of two communities hurled stones at each other during Muharram procession in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Tuesday. Police said people from the Hindu community  complained about the use of a DJ in the procession and hurled stones at those participating in the procession. They complained that a "new tradition" was being set with the use of DJ, police added.

198.title: Thai PM Prayut to stay in power for another 2 years, says Dy PM
198.article_body: Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha will be in power for two more years, Deputy PM Prawit Wongsuwan said on Tuesday. This comes as the main opposition party seeks a court ruling to remove the PM this month, a year before an election is due. Prayut can serve a maximum of eight years as the PM as per the country's Constitution.

199.title: N Korea ready to send 100,000 troops to participate in Ukraine war: Russian expert
199.article_body: Around 100,000 North Korean volunteers are ready to go to Russia and take part in the Ukraine war, Russian military expert Igor Korotchenko said recently on state TV. North Korean builders are ready to work alongside Russian builders to repair war damage, Korotchenko added. He said the troops are "resilient, undemanding and motivated".

200.title: I had no strength, it was one of the toughest moments: Hamilton on Abu Dhabi controversy
200.article_body: Lewis Hamilton, who had finished second in F1 2021 season after Max Verstappen defeated him in the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix following a controversy, said, "I do remember just sitting there in disbelief." "I had no strength. And it was one of the toughest moments, I would say, that I've had in a long, long time," he added.

201.title: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' becomes 5th Marvel film to earn ₹100 cr in India
201.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder', starring Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale and Natalie Portman, has become the fifth Marvel film to earn more than ₹100 crore at Indian box office. It is also the second Hollywood film after 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' to cross ₹100 crore this year in India. The film was released on July 7.

202.title: Was offered a role in 'Top Gun: Maverick' with Tom: Lewis Hamilton
202.article_body: Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton revealed that he was offered a role in the Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick'. "Cruise invited me to his set...when he was doing 'Edge of Tomorrow' and then we [gradually became friends]," Hamilton said. He added that declining the offer was "the most upsetting call that I think I've ever had [to take]".

203.title: Nitish's move driven by desire to run for PM in 2024: Chirag Paswan
203.article_body: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan on Tuesday said that Nitish Kumar's decision to sever ties with the BJP was driven by his "selfish desire" to run for PM in 2024. "I want to tell the parties which are now joining hands with Nitish Kumar that very soon, he will betray them as well and ruin their future," Paswan said.

204.title: Let's renew vow to defend freedom: Sonia on Quit India anniversary
204.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday urged citizens to defend India's freedom with "all our might" on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Quit India Movement. "Let us not forget the price that millions...paid for India's freedom," she said. Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said the people should take a 'Unite India' pledge to develop the country.

205.title: China confirms outbreak of new Langya virus, 35 people found infected
205.article_body: A new type of animal-derived Henipavirus named Langya has been detected in China's Shandong and Henan provinces, the state media reported. So far the virus has infected 35 people causing symptoms like fever, fatigue, cough, anorexia, nausea, vomiting etc. As per reports, the virus may also cause kidney and liver failure and is likely transmitted from animals to humans.

206.title: Massive cliff collapses onto a beach in UK, pic goes viral
206.article_body: A series of cliffs collapsed along the Devon coast in UK on Monday amid heatwave. The cliffs collapsed at Sidmouth and East Beach. The collapse of the Sidmouth cliff was the result of a second major landslide along the Jurassic Coast in two weeks. Temperatures have caused cracks in the rocks causing them to collapse.

207.title: Alia shot a scene like a pro despite being ill, everyone clapped: Darlings maker
207.article_body: 'Darlings' director Jasmeet K Reen recalled how Alia Bhatt filmed a crucial scene in the film while she was sick. "Alia was ill one day, but she still came for...shoot...We rolled...camera and she gave her take like a pro," Jasmeet said, adding, "The entire set stood and clapped, not because she was unwell, but because they loved what she did."

208.title: Naxal arrested after encounter in Chhattisgarh, arms & ammunition seized
208.article_body: An injured suspected Naxalite was arrested and a huge cache of arms and ammunition was seized after an encounter with the security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, a police official said on Tuesday. After the encounter, an SLR (self-loading rifle) with 29 live cartridges, an INSAS rifle with four live cartridges, explosives and Maoist literature were recovered, the official added.

209.title: Want to see Arshad and Neeraj in packed Pak stadium: Pak coach
209.article_body: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem's coach Syed Hussain Bukhari said he wants to see the athlete compete with Neeraj Chopra in a "packed stadium" in Lahore or Islamabad. "Neeraj is like our son. If Neeraj wins, we'll shower him with the same love as Milkha Singh Ji," he added. Arshad, during CWG 2022, broke the Games record to win gold.

210.title: AIADMK's first MP Maya Thevar passes away at the age of 87
210.article_body: AIADMK's first MP K Maya Thevar passed away on Tuesday due to cardiac arrest in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul at the age of 87. Thevar was handpicked by AIADMK founder MG Ramachandran to contest the party's maiden by-election in 1973. Condoling his death, former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam said, "It was he who selected the two leaves symbol for [AIADMK]."

211.title: 300 cooperatives onboarded as buyers on Centre's GeM portal
211.article_body: The onboarding of cooperatives as buyers on the Centre's Government e-Marketplace (GeM) was launched by Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday. Over 300 cooperatives have registered as buyers on the public procurement portal, Shah announced. Registering as buyers will give these cooperatives access to goods and services at competitive prices, an official statement said.

212.title: Assam & Meghalaya to hold border talks after Aug 15: CM Sangma
212.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Tuesday said that his government will hold talks with Assam's government to resolve the remaining six areas of dispute at the inter-state border after August 15. "We will be meeting in Guwahati," he added. Regional committees will be formed to take the process forward for the second phase of the border talks, he further said.

213.title: He had affairs with 8 women while dating me, always wanted sex: Giggs' ex to court
213.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs, who's on trial after being accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, had affairs with eight women while he was dating Greville, a court heard. Greville told the court Giggs had "full-on relationship" with the eight women. She stated that Giggs "always wanted sex", adding that she felt he was using her for sex.

214.title: It's my wedding date, don't want fans to imitate it: Naga on his tattoo
214.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya has shared the meaning behind his arm tattoo and said it's a Morse code for his wedding date. He also asked his fans to stop imitating his tattoo. "This isn't something you would want to imitate...I feel...bad when they tattoo these things," he said. Naga and Samantha got married in 2017 and announced their separation in 2021.

215.title: I'm very nervous about 'Laal...', haven't slept for over 48 hrs: Aamir
215.article_body: Ahead of the release of his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actor Aamir Khan in an interview said, "I'm very nervous right now, it's been over 48 hours I've not slept." "My brain is in overdrive, so I read books or play chess online," he added. Aamir further said he will sleep peacefully after the release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

216.title: Palestinians in West Bank to start flying from Israeli airport to Turkey
216.article_body: Palestinians from the occupied West Bank will be offered special flights from Ramon Airport near Israel's Eilat to Turkey, Israel's Airports Authority said on Tuesday. Palestinians in occupied territories can't fly from Israel's Ben Gurion Airport without special permission and often travel to Jordan to catch international flights. Notably, these flights won't be offered to Palestinians from Gaza.

217.title: Parliament panel seeks 1 adoption law for all including LGBT+ people
217.article_body: A Parliamentary panel report has called for a new law to make adoptions inclusive of all religions and the LGBTQIA+ community. The panel said such legislation should be more transparent, accountable and less bureaucratic. The recommendations further called for consonance between the Hindu Adoptions and Maintenance Act and the Juvenile Justice Act to make the process easier.

218.title: China, S Korea pledge to develop closer ties amid tensions in region
218.article_body: The Foreign Ministers of South Korea and China on Tuesday pledged to develop closer relations and maintain stable industrial supply chains. Notably, this comes amid tensions between the US and China over Taiwan. South Korea, a longtime US ally, is struggling to strike a balance between America and the increasingly assertive foreign policy of China, a report said.

219.title: K'taka govt planning construction of dams on Mahadayi river: Goa Cong
219.article_body: The Goa Congress claimed that Karnataka was planning to construct dams on Mahadayi river in violation of a Supreme Court order. A delegation led by Goa Congress chief Amit Patkar met Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai and sought his intervention. "We submitted a memorandum stating that people in Goa are...concerned about the failure of Goa government...to protect Mahadayi river," Patkar said.

220.title: Central Vista area for new PM's Office yet to receive clearance
220.article_body: The Central Vista's Executive Enclave, which will house the new Prime Minister's Office and Cabinet Secretariat, is yet to be cleared by the Delhi State Environment Impact Assessment Authority. A committee vetting the proposal had raised concerns over an "excessively high proportion" of tree removal from the site. The CPWD revised its proposal to comply with new rules.

221.title: Ramya Krishnan to shoot for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' from Aug 10
221.article_body: Actress Ramya Krishnan revealed that she will start shooting for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' from August 10 onwards. She said she is "very excited" about the film. As per the reports, the cast will be shooting for a special promo. The full-fledged shoot of the film will begin post August 15. Ramya had previously worked with Rajinikanth in 'Padikkathavan' and 'Padaiyappa'.

222.title: Sensitise officers handling human trafficking cases: Centre to HCs
222.article_body: The Home Ministry has ordered all High Courts (HCs) to organise a conference to sensitise judicial officers to deal with human trafficking-related matters. The government said it has noticed officers lacking awareness and training to handle such situations, leading to ineffective investigations. As per Central government data for 2020, there were 1,714 registered human trafficking cases in India.

223.title: AI Express crash survivors to build hospital for rescuers in Kerala
223.article_body: The survivors and families of those who died in Air India Express flight crash at Kerala's Calicut International Airport in 2020 have raised ₹50 lakh to build a hospital building for locals who had carried out rescue operations following the crash. The building will be constructed for a Public Health Centre, the only government health facility near the crash site.

224.title: Blasts at Russia's military base in Crimea leave 1 dead, 5 injured
224.article_body: One person was killed and at least five others were reported to be injured after blasts at Russia's military base in Crimea on Thursday, according to local authorities. The Russian Defence Ministry said that the "detonation of several aviation ammunition stores" had caused an explosion. There had not been any kind of attack, it added.

225.title: Nitish won't get that respect with RJD which he got with BJP: Sushil Modi
225.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi said Nitish Kumar won't get that respect with RJD which he got with BJP after he broke the alliance with them on Tuesday. "We made him CM despite having more seats...never tried to break his party," he said. "We broke only those who betrayed us. In Maharashtra, Shiv Sena betrayed us and faced consequences," he added.

226.title: Woman slips from rollercoaster seat, falls to her death in Germany
226.article_body: A 57-year-old woman died after falling 26 feet from a moving rollercoaster in Germany's Klotten on Saturday, authorities have said. The woman reportedly slid from her seat while the rollercoaster was taking a curve before falling from the track onto the ground. "There is currently no initial suspicion of criminal conduct", public prosecutors commenting on the woman's death said.

227.title: Biden signs $52.7 billion investment bill to compete against China
227.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday signed a bill to provide $52.7 billion in subsidies for US semiconductor production and research and to boost efforts to make US more competitive with China's science and technology efforts. "The future is going to be made in America," Biden said. Some Republicans joined Biden on the White House lawn to attend the signing.

228.title: Some play the game, others change it: Wimbledon after Serena announces retirement
228.article_body: After ex-world number one Serena Williams announced that she will be retiring from tennis following US Open 2022, Wimbledon tweeted, "Some play the game. Others change it. We hope the next few weeks bring you joy." The 40-year-old has won 73 singles titles, including 23 Grand Slams, on WTA Tour. Serena last won a Grand Slam at Australian Open 2017.

229.title: Shrikant Tyagi sent to 14-day judicial custody for assaulting Noida woman
229.article_body: Surajpur court has sent politician Shrikant Tyagi to 14-day judicial custody for assaulting and abusing a woman at a residential society in Noida. Tyagi was using an MLA sticker on his car which was allegedly given by Samajwadi Party MLC Swami Prasad Maurya. Tyagi was arrested from Meerut in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday.

230.title: Indian society highly sensitive to challenges of security: Jaishankar
230.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said Indian society is highly sensitive to challenges of security, perhaps to a greater extent than many of its contemporaries. India faces conventional and non-conventional threats of a wide range, he claimed. Having a large, pluralistic and diverse polity makes law and order issues and even internal security concerns more complicated, he added.

231.title: Crypto exchange Nuri GmbH files for insolvency in Germany
231.article_body: Crypto exchange Nuri GmbH has filed for insolvency with a Berlin court, the company said on Tuesday. It said the sell-off in the crypto market, the bankruptcy of the Celsius network and uncertainty in financial markets forced it to file for insolvency. "This challenging environment has had a lasting impact on the business development of Nuri GmbH," the company added.

232.title: Team India doesn't expect Kohli to score 70 or 100: Aakash ahead of Asia Cup
232.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli following his selection in India's 15-member squad for upcoming Asia Cup 2022, Aakash Chopra said it doesn't matter if the batter scores a 40 or 70 because everybody has a role to play in the team. "The team doesn't expect Kohli to score 70 or a 100 or finish the game," he added.

233.title: Tea exports rise 7% compared to last year in 1st 5 months of 2022
233.article_body: Indian tea exports in the first five months of 2022 (January-May) increased by around 7% to 78.64 million kg, compared to 73.19 million kg in the same period last year, the Tea Board said. Most stocks were picked up by the UAE at 13.17 million kg, followed by Russia (11.52 million kg). The value of exports was ₹2,037.78 crore.

234.title: Sri Lanka hikes power tariffs by 75% amid economic crisis
234.article_body: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka on Tuesday said that it has approved a 75% hike in power tariffs. "The Commission decided to approve a fair electricity tariff, taking all these public and other stakeholder comments into consideration," Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said. Notably, small consumers will face a 264% hike in the power tariff rate.

235.title: Artist paints Tricolour in his eye ahead of Independence Day in TN, shares pic
235.article_body: An activist and miniature artist from Tamil Nadu shared pictures and videos of the Tricolour flag painted inside his eye, ahead of the upcoming Independence Day. UMT Raja from Coimbatore first painted the national flag on the very thin cloth-like film on a chicken egg's albumen (egg white). He then transferred it to the sclera of his eye, News18 reported.

236.title: Ryan Giggs kicked naked girlfriend out of room at 5-star hotel in Dubai, court told
236.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs, who has been accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, kicked her out of their room at a five-star hotel in Dubai while she was naked, a court heard. Greville claimed that Giggs flipped when she saw him message another woman. "He dragged me into the lounge...threw my suitcase...and shut the door," she said.

237.title: He used to scold me when I used to play a rash shot: Sehwag on Koertzen
237.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag paid tribute to former umpire Rudi Koertzen, who passed away aged 73 in a road accident. "Had a great relation with him. Whenever I used to play a rash shot, he used to scold me saying, 'Play sensibly...I want to watch your batting'," Sehwag tweeted. Sehwag further called Koertzen a "gentleman and a very wonderful person".

238.title: 8 women farm labourers among 9 killed as autorickshaw & bus collide in Bengal
238.article_body: At least nine people, including eight women farm labourers, were killed after an autorickshaw and a state transport bus collided head on in West Bengal's Birbhum district on Tuesday. All nine victims were travelling in the autorickshaw, Birbhum SP Nagendra Nath Tripathi said. The incident occurred at Mallarpur near Rampurhat. The women were returning from a paddy field.

239.title: 'Laal...' earns ₹11 cr from advance booking, 'Raksha...' earns ₹4 cr: Report
239.article_body: Aamir Khan starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has earned ₹11.5 crore from advance booking, whereas Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan' has managed to collect around ₹4.5 crore so far, according to a report. While 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is releasing on approximately 4000 screens, 'Raksha Bandhan' has got around 4200 screens, the report stated. Both films are set to release on August 11.

240.title: EU enforces emergency plan to reduce gas consumption
240.article_body: The European Union (EU) enforced its emergency gas plan on Tuesday with member countries being asked to cut their gas consumption by 15% ahead of winter. The plan was framed to tackle a shortage in supply that could occur if Russia stopped deliveries as tensions mounted over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has already reduced gas deliveries to EU countries.

241.title: JDU-BJP alliance was nefarious, it was bound to break: Rajasthan CM
241.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said the JDU-BJP alliance in Bihar was "nefarious", which was bound to break. "The autocratic tendencies of [BJP has]...killed the democracy in Goa, Manipur, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh and now in Maharashtra," he added. Nitish Kumar resigned from the post of CM of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government in Bihar earlier today.

242.title: 4 Pakistani soldiers killed in suicide attack in North Waziristan
242.article_body: Four soldiers in Pakistan were killed in a suicide attack on a military convoy in the country's North Waziristan tribal district, the Inter-Services Public Relations Pakistan (ISPR) said on Tuesday. According to the ISPR, the suicide bomber rammed a three-wheeler into the convoy on Monday. The attack left seven others, including two civilians, injured, ISPR added.

243.title: 1st batch of Indian students stuck back home to return soon: China
243.article_body: China on Tuesday said it has started the process for the return of Indian students stuck back home due to the COVID-19 visa restrictions. "We believe we'll see the return of the first batch of Indian students very soon and we will continue to pursue it with relevant work while ensuring the safety against COVID," Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson said.

244.title: Bird collapses at PM Modi's residence due to dehydration, rescued
244.article_body: A two-member team of a wildlife body rescued a black kite from PM Narendra Modi's residence in New Delhi, after the raptor collapsed because of dehydration, a statement said on Tuesday. The bird is currently under observation and will be released into the wild once declared fit, Wildlife SOS said.

245.title: Iran grants furlough to jailed Iranian-French academic Adelkhah
245.article_body: Iranian-French academic Fariba Adelkhah has been released by Iran on furlough for five days, her lawyer told Iranian media on Tuesday. Adelkhah, who is a resident of France, was awarded a five-year prison term in 2020 on national security charges after her arrest during a trip to Iran in 2019. France has called the charges on Adelkhah "politically motivated".

246.title: Bihar crisis is due to BJP's obsession with devouring regional parties: Alva
246.article_body: The Opposition candidate for the recently concluded Vice-Presidential elections, Margaret Alva, has blamed BJP for the ongoing Bihar political crisis. "It (crisis) is a result of the BJP's obsession with first destabilising then devouring regional parties, to grab their space for itself," Alva said. She added, "Maharashtra, AP, Odisha, Telangana, Bengal, Jharkhand...same game plan is in play."

247.title: Panchayat elections to be held in Goa tomorrow
247.article_body: Goa's Panchayat elections will be held on Wednesday (August 10) with 186 Panchayat bodies, across 1,464 wards, going to polls, an election official said on Tuesday. There are 5,038 candidates contesting in North Goa and South Goa combined, which have 3.85 lakh and 4.11 lakh voters respectively. The polling will start at 8 am and end at 5 pm.

248.title: Pushing Bihar into darkness, fear: BJP's RS Prasad on Nitish Kumar
248.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday stated that JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar insulted the verdict of the people of Bihar by breaking his alliance with BJP. "Why are you (Nitish) pushing Bihar into darkness, fear and uncertainty?" Prasad questioned, adding, "Today you're claiming that the same BJP, which made you the Chief Minister, is conspiring to break your party."

249.title: BJP leader thrashes ex-Armyman, vandalises his salon in MP; video surfaces
249.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) leader Rituraj Chaturvedi was booked on Tuesday after a video, purportedly showing him thrashing a retired Army personnel at the former's salon in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa, surfaced online. As per reports, Chaturvedi had an old dispute with the salon owner. Chaturvedi, along with another person, was also allegedly seen vandalising the shop.

250.title: Happy to complete a hat-trick of CWG medals: Sindhu on winning singles gold
250.article_body: Following the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, Indian shuttler PV Sindhu tweeted, "Happy to complete a hat-trick of CWG medals and top it up with the big one (gold) for India." Sindhu won her maiden gold in women's singles event on Monday. Sindhu had won bronze at CWG 2014 and silver at CWG 2018 in women's singles.

251.title: France faces 4th heat wave amid historic drought
251.article_body: France's national weather agency said that the country is in the midst of its fourth heat wave of the year. The heat wave began in the south and is expected to spread across the country and last until the weekend, Météo-France added. The heat wave comes amid the most severe drought ever recorded in France.

252.title: Viral video shows fans dancing to 'Oo Antava' at India-WI T20I in US
252.article_body: A video shows fans dancing to the song 'Oo Antava' in the stands in Florida, US on the sidelines of the Indian cricket team's T20I match against West Indies recently. The song, picturised on Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Allu Arjun, was part of the film 'Pushpa: The Rise'. "The craze of Pushpa," a Twitter user commented.

253.title: Will promote Ramayana trail: Sri Lanka's tourism envoy Jayasuriya
253.article_body: Sri Lanka's newly-appointed tourism brand Ambassador and former cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya on Tuesday said that his country will concentrate on promoting the Ramayana trail to Indian tourists. Jayasuriya had met India's High Commissioner in Colombo, Gopal Baglay, on Monday. The Sri Lankan government aims to boost its tourism sector amid a severe economic crisis in the country.

254.title: Bihar crisis recalls days when Janata Dal was under one roof: Devegowda
254.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Devegowda commented on the ongoing political crisis in Bihar. "I have been watching the developments in Bihar. It made me think of the days when the Janata Dal Parivar was under one roof. It gave three PMs," Devegowda said. He added, "If the younger generation decides it can offer a good alternative to this great nation."

255.title: Justin Bieber speaks about racism at concert, says 'it's evil'
255.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber spoke about racism at his Norway concert, which took place on Sunday. While addressing his fans, the singer said, "We know that racism is evil. It's wrong." Justin said he and his fans "get to be the difference-makers". He added, "We get to be the ones to stand with our brothers and sisters and make a change."

256.title: I remember watching Serena, Venus with my grandmother: 27-yr-old Sakkari
256.article_body: Talking about 40-year-old Serena Williams and her sister, 42-year-old Venus, world number four Maria Sakkari said she remembers watching both ex-world number one players with her grandmother, adding it's great to still have them on Tour. The 27-year-old further said, "Serena is, in my opinion, the greatest female athlete." Serena and Venus have won 23 and seven Grand Slams respectively.

257.title: Nitish made a mistake in 2017 & has corrected it today: Ex-Bihar MP
257.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP from Bihar Ali Anwar on Tuesday said Nitish Kumar committed a big mistake by quitting the RJD alliance and joining NDA in 2017, and today, he has corrected it. "I welcome the decision of Nitish Kumar to join the grand alliance again and it's good for the larger interest of the people of Bihar," Anwar said.

258.title: Climate change worsened 58% of infectious diseases in humans: Study
258.article_body: Climate hazards like floods, heat waves and drought caused as a result of climate have worsened 58% of known infectious diseases in humans, including malaria, hantavirus, cholera and anthrax, a study stated. While flooding sickens people through disease-carrying mosquitos, rats and deer, warming oceans and heat waves taint seafood. Moreover, droughts bring bats carrying viral infections to people.

259.title: BJP MLA catches policemen extorting money in Rajasthan; 4 suspended
259.article_body: Four policemen were suspended in Rajasthan's Bikaner district for illegally extorting money from truck drivers on a highway, a police official said on Tuesday. This comes after BJP MLA Sumit Godara and other people caught the policemen extorting money and complained to top police officers. The suspended officers have been identified as Qasim Ali, Lal Singh, Sunil Kumar and Gopaldan.

260.title: Local AAP leader assaulted by CPI(M) workers in Kerala's Malappuram
260.article_body: A local Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader, Sawad Alipra, was allegedly attacked by CPI(M) workers at the office of a village panchayat in Kerala's Malappuram district. "I was beaten up on my face and dragged at the office without any provocation," Alipra said. Alipra was a local secretary of the CPI(M) before joining the AAP.

261.title: How much prize money has Serena Williams won in her career?
261.article_body: American tennis player Serena Williams, who'll retire after US Open 2022, has won 73 singles and 23 doubles titles in her career. The 40-year-old, who had turned professional in 1995, has won a total career prize money of $94,588,910, as per Women's Tennis Association (WTA). Serena is a 23-time singles' Grand Slam champion. She has won 365 Grand Slam matches.

262.title: Nepal bans entry of people coming from India over COVID-19 surge
262.article_body: Nepal has banned the entry of people coming from India amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. Recently, four Indian tourists, who entered Nepal from Jhulaghat border point in the country's Baitadi district, were sent back after testing COVID-19 positive. "We have also ramped up COVID-19 testing on Indians," Bipin Lekhak, Information officer at the Health Office in Baitadi, said.

263.title: Aamir, Naga Chaitanya visit National War Memorial in Delhi, pics surface
263.article_body: Ahead of the theatrical release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actors Aamir Khan, Mona Singh, Naga Chaitanya and the film's director Advait Chandan visited the National War Memorial in New Delhi. In the pictures that have surfaced online, they can be seen paying tribute to martyrs. The film, which also stars Kareena Kapoor Khan, is set to release on August 11.

264.title: Indian Youth Cong brings accident insurance scheme for its workers
264.article_body: On its 62nd Foundation Day, the Indian Youth Congress launched an accident insurance scheme, IYC Kawach, for its workers across the country. IYC President Srinivas BV said that the scheme has been introduced to "acknowledge the sacrifices of our dedicated workers". Notably, the scheme will be provided to all the workers in a phased manner.

265.title: 'Swarajya' will join politics at the right time: Ex-MP Sambhajiraje
265.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Sambhajiraje Chhatrapati on Tuesday said his newly launched outfit 'Swarajya' will join politics at an appropriate time. Unveiling the logo of his organisation in Maharashtra's Osmanabad, he said, "Swarajya will work for farmers, labourers, the cooperative sector, education and health." "We'll ensure that people who were deprived of power are strengthened," he added.

266.title: Hoist Sikh flags, not tricolour on August 15: SAD MP Simranjit Mann
266.article_body: SAD MP Simranjit Mann has urged people to put up Sikh flags on Independence Day, instead of the national flag as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "The best tribute to the 75th anniversary of Independence would be to liberate Ladakh from China, rather than fluttering flags. Besides, provide food and shelter to the poor," Mann had previously tweeted.

267.title: Netaji’s 'Delhi Chalo' site becomes Singapore's 75th national monument
267.article_body: Singapore has declared its iconic green site Padang its 75th national monument as the city-state marked its 57th National Day on August 9. Padang also happens to be the site where Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose gave the 'Delhi Chalo' slogan in July 1943. "Padang has special significance for...Indian community in Singapore," a professor at the National University of Singapore said.

268.title: Nitish to take oath as Bihar CM tomorrow, Tejashwi to be his Deputy: Reports
268.article_body: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar will take oath as the Chief Minister of Bihar as part of the Grand Alliance at 4 pm on Wednesday (August 10), reports said on Tuesday. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav will be his Deputy, reports added. The duo had earlier met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan to stake claim for government formation after Nitish exited NDA.

269.title: HC directs removal of encroachments on temple land in Chennai
269.article_body: Madras High Court has directed the local Tahsildar to inspect the properties belonging to Sri Venugopala Krishnaswamy temple in Chennai and submit the report to Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR & CE) Department. The department would proceed to remove the encroachments under the provisions of HR & CE Act in case any encroachment is reported, the court said.

270.title: Don't target Palestinian militants in Lebanon: Hezbollah to Israel
270.article_body: Militant group Hezbollah on Tuesday warned Israel against targeting Palestinian militants in Lebanon. This comes after Israel's defence minister on Saturday indicated the possibility of the country targeting Islamic Jihad members who could be spotted in "restaurants and hotels in Tehran, Syria and Lebanon". An Egypt-backed truce ended the recent fighting between Israel and Islamic Jihad on Sunday.

271.title: Air India CEO to meet employees to discuss eviction from staff housing: Report
271.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson is expected to meet employees residing in colonies that the airline owned in Mumbai and Delhi this week, Moneycontrol reported. He's expected to meet Air India's unions' representatives to expedite process of moving out of the colonies. Despite announcing reimbursement of expenses to vacate colonies, employees aren't ready to move, an Air India official said.

272.title: Difficult for me to do 5 films in a year, my two boys need me: Kareena
272.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan in an interview said, "I wish I could do like five films in a year." She added, "But...it's difficult for me...because my two boys (Taimur and Jeh) need me at this point." "I want to do...all five scripts right now, but...I can't. I'm going to be able to do...one this year, and...one next year," said Kareena.

273.title: You know you're getting old when candles cost more than cake, jokes Federer
273.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer, who turned 41 on Monday, thanked everyone for all the "amazing" birthday wishes. "You know you're getting old when the candles cost more than the cake," Federer said jokingly. Federer has not played on the ATP Tour since undergoing knee surgery following his Wimbledon quarterfinal loss against Poland's Hubert Hurkacz last year.

274.title: BTS’ J-Hope shares RM, Suga’s reactions to his song ‘What If’
274.article_body: BTS’ rapper-choreographer J-Hope opened up about how RM and Suga reacted to his song 'What If' from the 'Jack In The Box' album. J-Hope shared, “RM had said, ‘I’m proud that you’re trying this kind of music’, and Suga said, 'I will listen to music when it comes out so I can enjoy just as a listener’.”

275.title: AppLovin offers to buy video game software maker Unity in $17.5 bn deal
275.article_body: Gaming software company AppLovin Corp on Tuesday made an offer to buy Unity Software in a $17.5 billion all-stock deal. The enterprise value of the deal is $20 billion and AppLovin will offer $58.85/share to Unity, an 18% premium on its closing price on Monday. As part of the deal, Unity will own 55% of the combined firm's outstanding shares.

276.title: 17 soldiers killed in suspected attack by IS affiliate in Mali
276.article_body: An attack by suspected members of an Islamic State affiliate left 17 Malian soldiers and four civilians dead near the town of Tessit on Sunday, Mali's Army said in a statement issued on Monday. Moreover, nine soldiers were reported missing, the statement added. Vehicles and equipment were also destroyed in the attack, as per the statement.

277.title: Maharashtra reports 1,782 fresh COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths
277.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,782 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a health department release said. The state also recorded seven deaths due to the infection, the release added. Pune Municipal Corporation and Kolhapur district logged two deaths each, news agency PTI reported. Tuesday's new cases took Maharashtra's tally of active COVID-19 cases to 11,889.

278.title: Russia successfully launches Iranian satellite into space
278.article_body: A Russian rocket successfully launched an Iranian satellite into space from a base in Kazakhstan on Tuesday. Iran said their remote-sensing satellite, named Khayyam, has been fitted with a high-resolution camera and will be used for environmental monitoring. No other country will have access to information the satellite gathers, and it'll be only used for civilian purposes, Iran said.

279.title: Assam and Mizoram sign joint statement to resolve border disputes
279.article_body: The Assam and Mizoram governments on Tuesday signed a joint statement to resolve the decades-long border disputes amicably through dialogue. "Both the states agreed to promote and maintain peace and to prevent any untoward incident along the borders," the statement said. The Deputy Commissioners of the bordering districts of both states shall meet at least once in two months.

280.title: Nitish Kumar is opportunistic: Union Minister Ashwini Choubey
280.article_body: Union Minister Ashwini Choubey has accused Nitish Kumar of being "opportunistic" after the alliance between the BJP and JD(U) broke down. "Despite having lesser seats, we made him (Kumar) CM. He has deceived the people twice," Choubey said. He added, "The BJP does not suppress...[or] betray anyone. Those people betraying Bihar want to create obstacles in its development."

281.title: Was told to pay ₹99cr in damages over swimsuit pics: St Xavier's University teacher
281.article_body: A St Xavier's University Kolkata teacher, who was allegedly forced to resign after a complaint from a student's parent over her swimsuit pictures, claimed she was also told to pay ₹99 crore in damages to the University. The University allegedly said the pictures posted on the teacher's Instagram "caused immense, irreparable damage" to its image and goodwill.

282.title: BJP only buys people, didn't want its agenda in Bihar: Tejashwi
282.article_body: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday said that BJP only knows how to intimidate and buy people, adding that they didn't want the party's agenda to be implemented in Bihar. "Across the Hindi heartland, BJP does not have any alliance partner, history tells that BJP destroys the parties with whom it forms an alliance," Tejashwi said.

283.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi got 'MLA' sticker on vehicle from Swami Prasad Maurya: Police
283.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted a Noida woman, got a 'vidhayak (MLA)' sticker on one of his vehicles from ex-MLA Swami Prasad Maurya. Tyagi, who was absconding after an FIR was registered against him, was arrested on Tuesday. "A high-level inquiry is going on regarding the gunners provided to Tyagi by Ghaziabad police," Noida Police Commissioner Alok Singh said.

284.title: RSS a body of upper castes, PM Modi a great dramatist: Siddaramaiah
284.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Tuesday called RSS an "association of upper castes" and dubbed the Central government's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign a "drama". He also called PM Narendra Modi a "great dramatist", adding that RSS and BJP have opposed the national flag, anthem and the Constitution. "How can they be patriots?" he asked.

285.title: Serena Williams announces her retirement from tennis
285.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams announced that she will retire from tennis following US Open 2022. "I've never liked the word retirement...Maybe the best word to describe what I'm up to is evolution...I'm evolving away from tennis...toward other things that are important to me," she wrote in a Vogue article. The 40-year-old had turned pro in 1995.

286.title: Previous govt in Bihar wasn't as per people's mandate: Sharad Yadav
286.article_body: After Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP and resigned as Bihar CM, RJD leader Sharad Yadav said, "The previous [BJP-JDU] government was not as per the mandate of the people." "It's only now that the state government will be as per the people's mandate...People voted for the very same alliance...that has been formed now," Yadav added.

287.title: Pic shows cluster of stars held together by gravity, Instagram users call it 'incredible'
287.article_body: NASA has shared an image of a globular cluster, a tightly bound group of stars held together by gravity, taken by Hubble Space Telescope. "Clusters like this one, located in...constellation Sagittarius, can contain millions of stars, many of them nearly as old as the universe," wrote NASA. While some Instagram users called the picture "incredible", another comment read, "I'm...taken aback."

288.title: JD(U) broke alliance because of BJP's intimidation politics: D Raja
288.article_body: The General Secretary of the Communist Party of India, D Raja, has commented on JD(U) breaking its alliance with the BJP in Bihar. "Nitish Kumar breaking alliance...is a strong indictment of the politics of intimidation practised by the BJP," Raja said. He added, "BJP's authoritarianism leaves no scope for cooperation. After Akalis & Shiv Sena, JD(U) is the latest example."

289.title: Rare colourful sea slug spotted in British waters for the first time
289.article_body: An extremely rare multi-coloured sea slug, Babakina anadoni, which usually lives off Spain and Atlantic, was spotted in British waters for the first time. The creature is 2 cm long and was found in Isles of Scilly. "It's one of the prettiest sea slugs I've seen...it's less than half the size of your little finger," a Marine Conservation Officer said.

290.title: Pak TV channel ARY News pulled off air for 'seditious' reportage
290.article_body: Pakistani TV channel ARY News has been pulled off air in several parts of the country, the channel confirmed on Tuesday. The channel, blocked by Pakistan's media authority, was taken down for allegedly telecasting "seditious content", an official from the channel said. Terming the decision "illegal", Ammad Yousaf, ARY network's Vice President, said the ban will be challenged in court.

291.title: BJP destroys the parties with whom it forms an alliance: Tejashwi Yadav
291.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, after staking claim to form a government along with Nitish Kumar in Bihar, said, "Across the Hindi heartland, BJP doesn't have any alliance partner, history tells that BJP destroys the parties with whom it forms an alliance." He added, "We did see that happening in Punjab and Maharashtra." Nitish ended the alliance with BJP on Tuesday.

292.title: No credit can be taken away: Manjrekar on India's ODI, T20I series wins vs WI
292.article_body: On being asked how much should be read into India's 3-0 ODI and 4-1 T20I series wins against a "bad" West Indian side, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "No credit can be taken away from India for these wins." He added, "Let's be nice to...West Indies. They are good people to hang with...West Indies in T20 cricket are no minnows or rollovers."

293.title: 1,000 challans issued for plastic ban violations in Gurugram since July
293.article_body: More than 1,000 challans over the use of single-use plastic (SUP) were issued by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram between July 1 and August 6, an official statement said on Monday. Over 1,700 kilograms of SUP was seized from the violators, it added. The civic body has collected ₹7.35 lakh in fines during the same period, according to the statement.

294.title: Spiders could sleep like humans and have dreams: Study
294.article_body: A study has found that jumping spiders may sleep and dream like humans. Researchers observed that the babies of jumping spiders twitched their limbs while sleeping, the retinas in their eyes moved, and their legs curled. They concluded that these spiders might have a REM (rapid eye moment) sleep-like state, a phase of sleep closely associated with dreaming in humans.

295.title: Man saves dog on railway track from approaching train in Palghar
295.article_body: In a video that has surfaced on social media, a man is seen saving a dog sitting on a railway track from an approaching train in Palghar's Nalasopara. One of the onlookers at the platform helped the man climb up. The driver of the train reportedly seemed to have already spotted the dog and had slowed down the vehicle.

296.title: Kangana Ranaut diagnosed with dengue, continues to work on 'Emergency'
296.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has been diagnosed with dengue, her production house Manikarnika Films said on Tuesday. They shared a picture of Kangana working on the set of her directorial, 'Emergency', and wrote, "When [you've] alarmingly low white blood cell count and...yet you...work, it's not passion, it's madness." Reacting to the post, Kangana wrote, "Thank you team, body gets ill not...spirit."

297.title: After Delhi & Punjab, AAP recognised as State Party in Goa by EC
297.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday said that it has received State Party status in Goa from Election Commission (EC), following a review of AAP's performance in Goa Assembly elections. "After Delhi and Punjab, AAP is now a state recognised party in Goa...If we get recognised in one more state, we'll...be declared...a national party," AAP's National Convener Arvind Kejriwal tweeted.

298.title: Gurugram Police arrests gang of 4 involved in insurance fraud worth ₹6 cr
298.article_body: Gurugram Police has arrested a gang of four which allegedly cheated over 150 people of over ₹6 crore on pretext of reviving their lapsed insurance policies in last three months. The accused targeted victims aged between 50-70 years and had data of over five lakh victims. They had hired three female executives to call and get policyholders' details, police said.

299.title: Indian ship reaches B'desh port under transshipment pact trial
299.article_body: An Indian vessel from Kolkata port with cargo destined for India's northeastern region arrived at Bangladesh's Mongla seaport on Monday. The shipment arrived under the trial run for a bilateral agreement signed between India and Bangladesh in 2018. The agreement allows for the transshipment of Indian cargo through various routes to northeastern states via Bangladesh's Chittagong and Mongla ports.

300.title: Mahatma Gandhi's statue made from plastic waste unveiled in Noida
300.article_body: A 20-foot tall statue of Mahatma Gandhi made of around 1,000 kilograms of plastic waste was unveiled in Noida on the 80th anniversary of Quit India Movement. The statue symbolises Swachh Bharat Mission's 'Ek Kadam Swachhata ki Aur', a statement said. In July, a 'Plastic Exchange Mobile Van' service that exchanges plastic waste for eco-friendly products was launched in Noida.

301.title: Man cheats Delhi Sikh priest on pretext of kirtan opportunity in US
301.article_body: A 51-year-old man was arrested for allegedly cheating a Sikh priest of over ₹1 lakh on the pretext of providing a 'kirtan' opportunity in America, police said on Tuesday. The accused contacted the victim and promised 'kirtan' opportunities in America, a senior police officer said. The Sikh priest transferred ₹1.25 lakh to the bank account number given by the accused.

302.title: Nitish Kumar claims support of 164 MLAs after staking claim to Bihar govt
302.article_body: After staking claim to the Bihar government as part of 'Mahagathbandhan', JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar said he has the support of 164 MLAs in the 243-seater state legislative assembly. Kumar said he has submitted a list of the MLAs to Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan in Patna. "He (Chauhan) will let us know when oath-taking can take place," said Kumar.

303.title: Ex-Bihar CM JR Manjhi's party extends unconditional support to Nitish Kumar
303.article_body: Ex-Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi's Hindustani Awam Morcha (HAM) on Tuesday extended unconditional support to Nitish Kumar and the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD)-led Mahagathbandhan. Manjhi's HAM has four MLAs in the 243-member Bihar Assembly while Kumar's Janata Dal (United) has 45 MLAs and RJD has 79. Kumar resigned as Bihar's CM on Tuesday and ended his government's alliance with BJP.

304.title: Mindy Kaling visits Priyanka Chopra's restaurant in NYC, shares pic
304.article_body: American actress-filmmaker Mindy Kaling took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture from Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York. "Dreamy dosas, kofta korma, chaat and so much more at @sona. Love you @priyankachopra," she wrote. Re-posting Mindy's story on her Instagram account, Chopra wrote, "Love you and your continuous support."

305.title: Even if I'm hanged I won't apologise: Man who shot at Owaisi's car
305.article_body: In an interview, alleged BJP member Sachin Pandit said he won't apologise for shooting at AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's car in Uttar Pradesh. "I don't care even if I'm hanged," he added. Referring to ex-Prime Ministers Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi's assassination, he said, "I want to give [Owaisi] a message...No one should've such arrogance that [they can't be harmed]."

306.title: Wrestler Divya Kakran shares proof that she played for Delhi after AAP MLA's tweet
306.article_body: Wrestler Divya Kakran, who bagged bronze at CWG 2022, took to Twitter to share a certificate to prove she had represented Delhi at a tournament. This comes after AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj tweeted that Kakran always represented Uttar Pradesh. Bharadwaj tweeted it in response of Kakran claiming that Delhi government has never helped her or given her any prize money.

307.title: BBMP launches helpline to tackle monkey menace in B'luru
307.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has launched a toll-free number for the citizens to complain about problems created by monkeys, birds and snakes in the city. Residents can register their complaints either on the Namma Bengaluru Sahaaya 2.0 mobile app or can dial 1533. Repeated attacks by groups of monkeys in several residential societies were reported in Bengaluru recently.

308.title: Indian diaspora in UK organise 'havan' for PM candidate Rishi Sunak
308.article_body: A group of UK nationals of Indian origin reportedly organised a 'havan' wishing for PM candidate Rishi Sunak's victory and well-being. The organisers of the 'havan' reportedly said that they endorse Sunak because they think he can save the UK from a possible financial crisis. The results of the UK prime ministerial race will be announced on September 5.

309.title: No party in NDA is safe with alliance partner like BJP: TMC leader
309.article_body: Amid the political crisis in Bihar, Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Sukhendu Sekhar Ray said no political party in NDA is safe with an alliance partner like the BJP. "The BJP does not believe in smaller or regional parties' existence," Ray said. "Its policy ensures the wiping out of regional parties even if they are their allies," he added.

310.title: 770-page chargesheet submitted by police in B'luru acid attack case
310.article_body: Karnataka Police has submitted a 770-page chargesheet to a court in connection with the Bengaluru acid attack case that took place three months ago, police said on Tuesday. Police have named 92 witnesses in the chargesheet and arrested the culprit from Tamil Nadu. The victim, who is undergoing treatment, studied in the same school as the accused.

311.title: Women will get appropriate representation in state cabinet: Maha Dy CM
311.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said that women will get appropriate representation in the state cabinet. "The objection that there is no woman minister in the newly formed cabinet will be addressed soon," Fadnavis said. This comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday expanded his two-member ministry by inducting 18 ministers.

312.title: Ragpicker rapes & murders 46-year-old woman in Pune; arrested
312.article_body: A ragpicker has been arrested for the rape and murder of a 46-year-old woman in the Yerawada area of Pune. The accused attacked the woman after he found her alone at night, police officials said. He hit the woman on her head with a stone when she tried to resist the rape, the officials added.

313.title: Mullaperiyar dam safe in all aspects: MK Stalin to Pinarayi Vijayan
313.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Tuesday informed Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan that the Mullaperiyar dam is safe in all aspects. "Flood regulation of the dam is being done as per the Rule curve and gate operation schedule," Stalin said. Pinarayi Vijayan on August 5 wrote to Stalin seeking his intervention in regulating water discharge from Mullaperiyar dam.

314.title: UP man gets life imprisonment for killing mother over property
314.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura sentenced a man, identified as Hari Singh, to life imprisonment for killing his mother over property, officials said on Tuesday. The court also imposed a fine of ₹14,000 on the convict. Singh opened fire at his mother Chandravati Devi in January 2016, killing her on the spot, assistant district government advocate said.

315.title: Jitendra Agarwal appointed as DC of Delhi Excise Department
315.article_body: Jitendra Agarwal has been named the new Deputy Commissioner of the Excise Department by the Delhi government. He was holding additional charges of the Director of Archaeology, Special Secretary of ACL and Director (Panchayat). The government has also ordered an additional charge of the General Manager of Delhi Tourism and Transportation Development Corporation to IAS Geetika Sharma.

316.title: No morality, power is motive behind Nitish Kumar's move: RK Singh
316.article_body: BJP leader RK Singh on Tuesday raised questions over the political moves of Nitish Kumar, asking how he would justify an alliance with the RJD, which he has often called "corrupt". "All of this is politics for power. There is no morality and he should be ashamed," he said. Fifteen years of RJD rule took Bihar backwards, he said.

317.title: NIA arrests two terrorists in JMB case
317.article_body: Two Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) terrorists have been arrested by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). They have been identified as Hamidullah and Mohammad Sahadat. They were involved in propagating the JMB ideology and motivating youth to carry out jihad. “The accused are involved in propagating jihad by posting hateful and incriminating materials online in various groups,” said NIA.

318.title: PM Modi remembers freedom fighters, shares picture of Mahatma Gandhi
318.article_body: On Quit India movement's anniversary, PM Narendra Modi paid tributes to freedom fighters who strengthened country’s freedom struggle. He shared a picture of Mahatma Gandhi at the start of the movement in Bombay. “Inspired by Bapu, the Quit India movement witnessed remarkable participation from people across all sections of society including greats like JP and Dr Lohia,” tweeted PM Modi.

319.title: More rainfall likely in Pune, ghat regions till August 11
319.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast more rainfall in Pune till August 11 (Thursday) and issued a red alert for ghat regions around Pune including Bhor, Velhe, Mulshi, Maval, Khed, Ambegaon and Junnar tehsils. A three-day rain alert has also been issued for Mumbai. Raigad, Ratnagiri and Satara are still under a red alert.

320.title: Actor Saibal Bhattacharya attempts suicide, hospitalised in critical condition
320.article_body: Bengali actor Saibal Bhattacharya allegedly attempted suicide at his Kolkata home and shared a video of himself in a hurt state on Facebook, as per reports. He is currently admitted to Chittaranjan Hospital and is in critical condition, reports added. He was reportedly suffering from depression and also struggled with substance abuse.

321.title: Betrayal of Bihar's people: Bihar BJP chief as Nitish Kumar breaks alliance
321.article_body: After JD(U)'s Nitish Kumar broke alliance with the BJP earlier today, Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said, "Whatever happened today is...betrayal of Bihar's people and...BJP." "We fought the 2020 polls together under the NDA, the mandate was for JD(U) and BJP, we won more seats despite that Nitish Kumar was made the CM," he added.

322.title: Nitish Kumar elected leader of Bihar 'Mahagathbandhan' after quitting NDA
322.article_body: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar has been elected as the leader of Bihar's Grand Alliance or 'Mahagathbandhan' which includes Left parties, RJD and Congress. He was elected as the leader of the alliance before reaching Raj Bhawan in Patna to stake claim to form government in the state. He exited NDA on Tuesday and resigned from the CM post.

323.title: What a legend: Hardik on Pollard becoming 1st cricketer to play 600 T20 games
323.article_body: After West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard became the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya tweeted, "Congratulations Polly, 600 matches and counting, what a legend." Pollard achieved this feat during his side London Spirit's match against Manchester Originals at ongoing The Hundred tournament at Lord's. He's scored 11,723 runs in the format.

324.title: Domino's Pizza quits Italy amid competition from local restaurants
324.article_body: Domino's Pizza has closed its last 29 branches in Italy amid tough competition from local restaurants expanding delivery services and has sought protection from creditors after running out of cash and falling behind on debt obligations. Domino's had entered Italy in 2015 through a franchise agreement with ePizza SpA. It had reduced operations in Italy from its peak in 2020.

325.title: Congress promises 300 units free electricity in poll-bound Himachal
325.article_body: The Congress has promised 300 units of free electricity to every household and ₹1,500 per month to women between the ages of 18 and 60 years if voted to power in Himachal Pradesh. The state polls are likely to be held in December. Congress' Bhupesh Baghel also said the old pension scheme will be restored if the party is elected.

326.title: Pakistani militant with $3 million US bounty killed in Afghanistan
326.article_body: Senior Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) leader Omar Khalid Khorasani with $3 million US bounty was killed in a blast in Afghanistan. "Khorasani and two other members of the banned outfit were killed in a roadside bomb attack...on Sunday evening," an Afghan Taliban spokesman said. Notably, this comes amid talks between Pakistan and the TTP that are being facilitated by the Taliban.

327.title: Don't issue European tourist visas to Russians: Estonia & Finland
327.article_body: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas and her Finnish counterpart Sanna Marin have urged European countries to stop issuing tourist visas to Russians, stating that they shouldn't be able to vacation in Europe amid the Ukraine war. Notably, both Estonia and Finland border Russia and are members of the European Union, which banned air travel from Russia after it invaded Ukraine.

328.title: Bus parked outside Pune school catches fire, no injuries reported
328.article_body: An unoccupied school bus parked on the campus of a primary school in Pune's Hadapsar area caught fire on Tuesday morning, but no casualties or injuries were reported, according to the Pune fire brigade. The officials suspect the fire to have started from the front side of the bus because of a short circuit in the electric wiring.

329.title: Will remain BJP ally, impossible to get leader like PM Modi: Bihar leader & Union minister
329.article_body: Amid the political crisis in Bihar, Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party chief and Union minister Pashupati Kumar Paras said his party will remain with BJP as it's impossible to get another leader like PM Narendra Modi. "Our party is with the BJP 100%," he added. Nitish Kumar resigned as Bihar CM after ending his government's alliance with the BJP on Tuesday.

330.title: Told him 'I need biggest iconic star of India': Aamir on SRK's 'Laal...' cameo
330.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan will make a cameo appearance in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Aamir Khan has confirmed. Speaking about how he got Shah Rukh to do a cameo in the film, Aamir said, "[He's] a friend. I told him, 'I [need]...someone who can represent what Elvis Presley represented in America...I need the biggest iconic star of India.' He was...sweet and...said, 'Yes'."

331.title: Shami must go for the ICC T20 WC 2022: Kiran More
331.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More said that the Indian team won't go into the T20 World Cup 2022 until pacer Mohammed Shami "comes into the side". "Rahul Dravid...likes to have back-ups. If a bowler gets injured, someone like Avesh Khan can be useful...but...Jasprit Bumrah (if fit) and Shami will definitely go to World Cup," More said.

332.title: You have brought great laurels: Kohli to Indian contingent at CWG 2022
332.article_body: Following the conclusion of CWG 2022 in Birmingham, India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to congratulate all the Indian medallists and participants and wrote, "You have brought great laurels for our country...we are so proud of you." India finished fourth in the CWG 2022 medal standings. India won 22 gold, 16 silver and 23 bronze medals.

333.title: Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav meet Bihar Governor, stake claim to form new govt
333.article_body: JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday to stake claim to form the new government in the state. Earlier today, Nitish Kumar ended the alliance with the BJP and resigned from the post of Bihar Chief Minister. Tejashwi Yadav has reportedly claimed the support of 160 MLAs.

334.title: Former cricket umpire Rudi Koertzen dies aged 73 in car crash in South Africa
334.article_body: Former cricket umpire Rudi Koertzen passed away in a car crash in South Africa. The 73-year-old was on his way back home in Despatch from Cape Town when a head-on collision near Riversdale took his life. Three other people were also killed in the accident. Koertzen officiated as an on-field umpire in 331 men's international matches.

335.title: I don't believe in perfection: Aamir Khan on 'Mr Perfect' tag
335.article_body: Aamir Khan, speaking about being called 'Mr Perfect', said he doesn't believe in perfection. "I think this tag was given...by...media because I'd a very long period in which...I didn't have a film that didn't work," he added. Aamir further said he really loves magic, adding that a magical moment is much more attractive to him than something that's just perfect.

336.title: BJP calling welfare schemes for the poor as freebies: TRS MLC
336.article_body: TRS leader K Kavitha criticised BJP and accused it of calling welfare schemes for the poor as freebies. "Majority of Indian population is poor, every government, be it Centre or State, runs welfare schemes for them," she said. "The manner in which you're attempting to force...state governments to shut these down by creating an atmosphere is not correct," she added.

337.title: 2 suspected JMB members arrested by NIA in MP's Bhopal
337.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested two alleged members of the banned Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) from Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. NIA recovered objectionable material from their possession, Mishra added. The accused were allegedly involved in propagating the JMB ideology and motivating the youth to carry out jihad against India, NIA said.

338.title: MP Arun Sao appointed Chhattisgarh BJP chief
338.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Tuesday appointed Arun Sao as new President of its Chhattisgarh unit. The 53-year-old MP from Bilaspur belongs to the Sahu community and was first elected to Lok Sabha in 2019. He will replace tribal leader Vishnu Deo Sai. The development comes ahead of Assembly polls in Chhattisgarh which are scheduled to take place next year.

339.title: Dividing people on caste, religion will weaken country: UP CM Yogi
339.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said India's strength lies in its unity. "When we're divided on the basis of caste, creed, religion, region and language, it only divides our strength, weakens India...and gives rise to disorder and anarchy," CM Yogi added. He was addressing a programme to mark the Kakori incident that took place on August 9, 1925.

340.title: Dalit yatra carrying 1,000-kg Ambedkar coin to Delhi stopped in Haryana
340.article_body: A group of Dalits who started a yatra from Ahmedabad to Delhi last week, carrying a 1000-kg brass coin featuring BR Ambedkar, was stopped from entering Haryana on Sunday. The group was reportedly prevented entry due to lack of permission from Delhi and Haryana police. The coin carried a message about the prevalence of untouchability despite 75 years of independence.

341.title: Pics show SDPI flag being hoisted at Bihar govt school; probe ordered
341.article_body: Pictures purportedly showing people hoisting Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) flag at a government school in Bihar's Nalanda have surfaced online. Some children are purportedly seen saluting the flag in the pictures. The district administration has ordered a probe into the incident. SDPI is the political wing of Islamic outfit Popular Front of India (PFI).

342.title: CAQM proposes ban on pre-BS-VI diesel vehicles' entry in Delhi from Oct 1
342.article_body: Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) has proposed a draft policy to ban entry of pre-BS-VI diesel vehicles in Delhi from October 1 if the air quality index exceeds 450. The policy will include ban on entry of diesel commercial vehicles. Fuel stations will also be mandated to sell fuel only to vehicles with valid PUC certificates from Jan 1.

343.title: In a first, Hyderabad Traffic Police issue advisory in Urdu on Muharram
343.article_body: In a first, the Hyderabad Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory regarding diversions imposed in view of the Muharram procession in the city in Urdu. "Henceforth we will be sending traffic advisories in Urdu language wherever we find it's needful to public," an official said. The traffic police also earned accolades from citizens on social media for this move.

344.title: 14-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death on suspicion of theft in Varanasi
344.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by upper-caste Hindu men in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi. "My son...had gone to a shop...where the owner...along with his friends...accused [him] of stealing mangoes and rice. They...beat my son mercilessly until he fell unconscious," the boy's father said in his complaint. He was taken to a hospital, where he died during treatment.

345.title: July 2022 was Spain's hottest month in over 60 yrs: Weather agency
345.article_body: This year's July was the hottest month in Spain in over six decades, the country's meteorological agency AEMET has said. This July recorded an average temperature of 25.6°C, which was 2.7°C higher than the recorded average for previous months of July in Spain. The highest temperature was recorded in southern Morón de la Frontera town at 46°C on July 24.

346.title: Man poses as IAS Tina Dabi and seeks money, Amazon gift cards; arrested
346.article_body: A man from Dungarpur, Rajasthan was arrested for attempting to cheat people by seeking money and gift cards by impersonating Jaisalmer Collector Tina Dabi. The matter came to light when a RAS officer employed as Rajasthan government's UIT Secretary received an e-mail from the fraudster who sought an Amazon gift card from her. She called Dabi who alerted the SP.

347.title: We let ourselves down: India coach on 0-7 loss vs Aus in CWG final
347.article_body: Indian men's hockey team coach Graham Reid said the team didn't play well "at all" in their 0-7 loss against Australia in the gold medal match at CWG 2022. "There's a thing called energy...We didn't have that," added Reid. Reid stated the team failed to execute the aspects they had discussed. "We've a lot of work to do," he said.

348.title: All MPs, MLAs are at consensus that we should leave NDA: Nitish Kumar
348.article_body: After submitting his resignation to Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan, JD(U)'s Nitish Kumar said, "All MPs and MLAs are at consensus that we should leave the NDA." This comes after Kumar ended his government’s alliance with the BJP. According to reports, he will stake claim to form a new government in the state with the support of Lalu Prasad Yadav’s RJD.

349.title: 61 medals have been bagged, records have been set, I congratulate all: Anurag Thakur
349.article_body: Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur has congratulated the Indian contingent for their performance at the recently-concluded Commonwealth Games 2022. "61 medals have been bagged. Athletes have set new records. PM Modi would continue to boost their morale as they return to India," he stated. India finished on the fourth position with 22 golds at the CWG 2022 in Birmingham.

350.title: Soon political parties in different states will stand against BJP: Akhilesh Yadav
350.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday reacted to the ongoing political situation in Bihar. "I think soon political parties and people in different states will stand against BJP," Yadav added. "It's a good start. On this day the slogan of 'Angrezo Bharat Chhodo' was given and today the slogan of 'BJP Bhagaon' is coming from Bihar," he stated.

351.title: US healthtech firm Basys.ai plans India entry to build AI technology
