351.article_body: Basys.ai, a Harvard-based healthtech startup, is in talks with healthcare providers in India and Singapore to launch its platform in these markets. The firm is depending on the central government's Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission, which aims to interlink digital health solutions across the country. The startup aims to collaborate with hospitals and build its artificial intelligence capability.

352.title: Union Minister Amit Shah urges cooperatives to register on GeM portal
352.article_body: Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday urged all the cooperatives to register themselves on the Government e-Marketplace (GeM) portal. Addressing the e-launch event for onboarding of cooperatives on the portal, Shah said more than 300 cooperatives, including 45 multi-state cooperative societies have been onboarded on GeM as buyers to buy goods from MSMEs and other businesses.

353.title: Nitish meets RJD's Rabri & Tejashwi after quitting NDA and stepping down as CM
353.article_body: After resigning as the Chief Minister of Bihar, Nitish Kumar met RJD's Rabri Devi and his son Tejashwi Yadav in Patna. Earlier in the day, Kumar met Governor Phagu Chauhan and tendered his resignation after ending his government's alliance with the BJP. As per reports, he will stake a claim to form a new government with the support of RJD.

354.title: CBI sends notice to TMC leader in cattle smuggling scam
354.article_body: After TMC leader Anubrata Mondal skipped meeting CBI officials on Monday in connection with the cattle smuggling scam, the probe agency has planned to send officers to his residence today to serve him yet another summon for August 10. “We have asked him to come to our Nizam Palace office on Wednesday morning at around 11 am," an official said.

355.title: AAP MLA removes toll barrier in Punjab, cars pass without paying fee
355.article_body: AAP MLA Karambir Singh Ghuman allegedly removed a toll plaza barrier in Punjab's Hoshiarpur to let his car pass on Saturday. A video showed other cars also crossing the barrier without paying toll after Ghuman removed the barrier. As per reports, Ghuman got angry and abused the toll plaza staff as they didn't remove the barrier immediately after his arrival.

356.title: Guj tribals believe in vision of Modi; won't fall for enticement: CM Patel
356.article_body: On the occasion of World Tribal Day, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel said that the development of Gujarat's tribal community has been happening "under Narendra Modi's leadership" for over two decades. "Gujarat [tribals] are more developed...than the tribals in...other parts of India...[They] do not fall for any enticements but believe firmly in the development vision of Modi," CM Patel said.

357.title: Officer shoots himself with service weapon inside Assam police station
357.article_body: An Assistant Sub Inspector posted at the Tinsukia Sadar police station in Assam allegedly committed suicide using his service weapon on Monday. He was rushed to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries while receiving treatment. An inquiry committee will be set up to ascertain the motive behind the action. The deceased is survived by his wife and two children.

358.title: Inflows into mutual fund schemes dropped by 43% in July: AMFI data
358.article_body: The Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed that inflows into equity mutual fund schemes dropped by 43% to ₹8,898 crore in July as against ₹15,495 crore in June. This was the third straight month of decline in inflows as investors were booking profits amid a rally in benchmark indices. The net inflows in May were ₹18,529 crore.

359.title: We get over 300 applicants per job: US CEO who pays staff minimum ₹63 lakh/year
359.article_body: Dan Price, CEO of a US-based company Gravity Payments, tweeted that his company pays its staff a minimum annual salary of $80,000 (around ₹63 lakh) along with benefits like paid paternal leave and remote work. He remarked, "We get over 300 applicants per job." His company set a minimum annual salary of $70,000 for all employees in 2015.

360.title: Defence around Ukraine's nuclear plant to be beefed up: Russia-backed official
360.article_body: Anti-aircraft defences around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will be strengthened after days of reported shelling on the site, a news agency quoted a Russia-backed official. Yevgeny Balitsky reportedly said that Europe's largest nuclear station is working normally and damaged power lines have been restored. Russia and Ukraine blame each other for attacks on the nuclear power plant.

361.title: Indian airlines witnessed 478 technical snags in 12 months: Govt
361.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha on Monday that 478 incidents of technical snags were reported by Indian airlines in the one year between July 1, 2021 and June 30, 2022. With 184 snags, Air India was most affected by these issues followed by IndiGo and SpiceJet reporting 98 and 77 incidents, respectively.

362.title: 3 men cheat gangster Chhota Shakeel’s close aide of ₹50 lakh in Mumbai
362.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested three people on Monday for cheating gangster Chhota Shakeel's close aide Salim Fruit of ₹50 lakh by falsely promising to save him from the National Investigation Agency's (NIA) probe. Mohd Salim Mohd Iqbal Qureshi, aka Salim Fruit, was arrested on Thursday by NIA in a case related to the activities of the D Company.

363.title: EU submits its 'final text' for the revival of Iran nuclear deal
363.article_body: As indirect talks between Iran and the US to salvage the 2015 nuclear deal concluded on Monday, the EU said it submitted the "final text" for the pact's revival. Stating that there is no room for further negotiations, EU's foreign policy chief said that "behind every technical issue...lies a political decision that needs to be taken in the capitals".

364.title: Man takes bath in pothole to protest against poor roads in Kerala; video goes viral
364.article_body: A man took bath in a pothole to protest against poor roads in Kerala, with his video going viral on social media. The video comes days after a scooter rider lost his life due to a pothole in Ernakulam district. In the video, local MLA UA Latheef is also seen reaching the spot where the man staged his protest.

365.title: No representation of women in Maha Cabinet shows BJP's mentality: NCP MP
365.article_body: Following Maharashtra Cabinet expansion, NCP MP Supriya Sule on Tuesday said that women have not been represented in the state Cabinet. "Unfortunate that there are 18 ministers in state Cabinet...when 50% of the population in the country is of women...they are not represented in this Cabinet," Sule added. "It shows BJP's mindset," she stated.

366.title: Chirag says credibility of Nitish is zero, demands President's rule in Bihar
366.article_body: LJP chief Chirag Paswan reacted to Nitish Kumar's decision of breaking the alliance with BJP and said, "Today credibility of Nitish Kumar is zero." He demanded President's rule in Bihar and said that the state should go for a fresh mandate. "Do you (Nitish Kumar) have any ideology or not? In next polls, JDU will get zero seats," he said.

367.title: 'Mission Mangal' is seen as Akshay's film when it had 5 leading ladies: Vidya
367.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has called it unfortunate that 2019 film 'Mission Mangal' is seen as an Akshay Kumar film when it has five leading ladies. The actress added that the story couldn't have been told with just Akshay. "Someone was talking to me about my last hits...They didn't mention 'Mission Mangal' and they said, 'Woh toh Akshay Kumar'," Vidya said.

368.title: Man who attempted to 'assassinate' MLA Jeevan Reddy arrested in Hyd
368.article_body: A man who allegedly tried to assassinate TRS MLA A Jeevan Reddy last week has been arrested from Hyderabad. The man was identified as the husband of a village sarpanch who was recently suspended from the TRS. Police said the man had a grudge against Reddy as he suspected the MLA's role in his wife's suspension.

369.title: 2 held, juvenile apprehended for killing truck driver during robbery in Delhi
369.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men and apprehended a 16-year-old for allegedly killing a 27-year-old truck driver during a robbery bid in Delhi's Pul Prahladpur area. The truck driver was stabbed to death when he tried to resist, police said. The incident took place on Sunday when the truck driver had gone to ease himself, police added.

370.title: Mobile data services restored in Manipur amid law & order crisis
370.article_body: Mobile data services, which were suspended for five days from August 6 onwards, will be restored in Manipur with immediate effect, a state government order read. The services were suspended over a law and order crisis after a vehicle was set ablaze by three-four men in Phougakchao Ikhang, which sparked communal tensions. Section 144 has been imposed in two districts.

371.title: 'Lagaan' character shouldn't have been clean-shaven, there was no water: Aamir
371.article_body: Speaking about his 2001 film 'Lagaan', actor Aamir Khan stated that his character Bhuvan should not have been clean-shaven. "It's not been raining [in the film]...and this guy shaves every day. He has got some secret water supply," the actor added. Aamir further said director Ashutosh Gowariker wanted a particular look for the character and insisted on him being clean-shaven.

372.title: Very secure actor: Akshay on Raksha Bandhan co-star Bhumi Pednekar
372.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar tweeted an appreciation post for Bhumi Pednekar. He called Bhumi "a very secure actor" for starring in his upcoming film Raksha Bandhan. "My appreciation and respect for my friend and co-star @bhumipednekar has gone up so much. Takes a very secure actor to agree to do a film titled #RakshaBandhan that features 4 sisters," he tweeted.

373.title: Be nice please: Manjrekar on being asked if Indian team is SA of women's cricket
373.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar, on being asked if the Indian team can be termed as chokers or the South Africa of women's cricket, said, "You guys are so hard...Be nice please...the Indian women's team have done tremendously well." Manjrekar further said, "In this CWG and you have seen it in these last few months that India have taken a leap."

374.title: Passenger from Dubai arrested with gold worth ₹45 lakh at Delhi airport
374.article_body: An Indian resident was held at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after being found in possession of 1,000 grams of gold worth over ₹45 lakh, officials said on Monday. Two gold chains were recovered from the man after a search of his person while approaching the exit gate. Officials have seized the gold and arrested the passenger.

375.title: Ready to lead India into the 5G revolution: Airtel
375.article_body: Airtel announced that it has acquired 19,867.8 MHz spectrum in 900 MHz, 1800 MHz, 2100 MHz, 3300 MHz and 26 GHz frequency bands in the latest spectrum auction. Having the widest mobile broadband footprint, it will lead India’s 5G revolution, said Airtel. It has also joined hands with multiple technology partners, including Ericsson, Samsung, and Nokia to deliver 5G services.

376.title: Lebanese buyer refuses delivery from first Ukrainian ship over delay
376.article_body: First ship to depart from Ukraine is looking for another port to unload grains as initial Lebanese buyer refused to accept delivery citing a more than five-month delay, according to Ukrainian embassy in Lebanon. The Razoni, carrying 26,527 tonnes of corn, had left from Odesa last week. According to ship tracking data, the Razoni has been anchored off Turkey's coast.

377.title: 600 games! What a milestone: Bumrah on Pollard playing 600 T20 matches
377.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has congratulated West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard on becoming the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history. "600 games! What a milestone...amazing achievement for an amazing player! Congratulations Polly," tweeted Bumrah. Pollard, who made his T20 debut in 2006, played his 600th T20 game in The Hundred on Monday.

378.title: Sisodia's allegations against me on Delhi excise policy baseless: Baijal
378.article_body: Former Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal on Tuesday said allegations raised by Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on the Delhi excise policy "are baseless and are motivated against" him. "During my tenure as the LG, I upheld the constitutional values and laws of the land," Baijal added. Dismissing Delhi government's claims, Baijal said, "The record will speak for itself."

379.title: BJP is like washing machine; cleans leaders who go there: Sena leader
379.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Kishori Pednekar on Tuesday claimed the BJP is like a washing machine and once leaders go there, they come out clean. Pednekar's comment came following the induction of rebel Shiv Sena MLAs Sanjay Rathod and Abdul Sattar into the Maharashtra cabinet. Rathod resigned last year over his alleged link to a woman's death.

380.title: Taiwan carries out military exercises as Chinese drills continue
380.article_body: Taiwan launched military exercises on Tuesday as China continued its military drills that began last week in the aftermath of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. Taiwan's Eighth Army Corps spokesperson said that the military drills were scheduled exercises and were not in response to Chinese drills. Taiwan will carry out military drills again on Thursday.

381.title: India B bag bronze medal in open section of 44th Chess Olympiad
381.article_body: India B team comprising Gukesh D, Nihal Sarin, R Praggnanandhaa, Adhiban Baskaran and Raunak Sadhwani bagged bronze medal in the open section of 44th Chess Olympiad in Chennai. Uzbekistan bagged gold, while Armenia clinched silver in the open category. India 2 finished with 18 points. This is India's second medal in open category at Chess Olympiad, excluding online Chess Olympiads.

382.title: You'll not see successful actor say, 'I am a pan-India star': Hansika
382.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani, speaking about actors being termed 'pan-India star', has said, "You will never see a successful person introduce themselves as, 'Hi, I'm a pan-India star'." She added, "They will always say, 'I'm an actor, I am an Indian actor'." However, Hansika stated that there can be pan-India films. "I'm an entertainer. That's what I call myself," she said.

383.title: Whatever I learnt in B'wood is by myself, used my understanding: Kartik
383.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that he's an outsider in the film industry and knew nobody from Bollywood. "Whatever I have learnt in this industry, I have learnt by myself, using my understanding...that has really helped me," he added. Kartik has stated that he is a quick learner and that has helped him. Kartik recently featured in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

384.title: India should've kept an extra seamer: Saba Karim on squad for Asia Cup
384.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said India should have included an extra pacer in their 15-member squad for the upcoming Asia Cup. Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan are the only pacers in the squad. "Should have kept an extra seamer in the squad because teams usually play with three seamers," explained Karim.

385.title: It's a new beginning: Satwiksairaj on men's doubles CWG gold in badminton
385.article_body: Shuttler Satwiksairaj Rankireddy, who along with Chirag Shetty won India's first-ever men's doubles gold at the Commonwealth Games, has said it's like a "new beginning" for badminton in India. He added, "It's a great feeling we could do it...It [was] a fantastic day for the badminton players. With Sindhu winning gold, then we, so there is no looking back now."

386.title: BJP never initiated anything: Union Minister on Bihar political situation
386.article_body: Amid the political situation in Bihar, Union Minister Kaushal Kishore on Tuesday said BJP never initiated anything that may stir up a controversy. "BJP would want that government of JD(U), BJP and other parties, under the Chief Ministership of Nitish Kumar, continues to work strongly and this is in the interest of Bihar as well as the nation," he added.

387.title: 35-yr-old farmer, wife shot dead in UP's Hathras; probe launched
387.article_body: A 35-year-old farmer and his wife were shot dead in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district on Tuesday. The incident reportedly took place around 2:30 am when the couple was sleeping in their house. "Primary investigation...revealed that...bullet was fired from a distance of two-three feet. A country-made firearm and two empty cartridges were recovered from...crime scene," a police official said.

388.title: Live-action 'Pac-Man' movie in the works: Reports
388.article_body: A live-action movie based on the popular arcade game 'Pac-Man' is in the works, according to reports. Bandai Namco Entertainment, the company behind Pac-Man, and actor Justin Baldoni's Wayfarer Studios have teamed up to develop the project. It will be based on an original idea from 'Sonic the Hedgehog' creator Chuck Williams, as per The Hollywood Reporter.

389.title: Nothing went right: India captain Manpreet on 0-7 loss vs Aus in CWG final
389.article_body: Following the Indian men's hockey team's 0-7 defeat against Australia in their gold medal match at CWG 2022, captain Manpreet Singh said, "Nothing went right." "We...hoped for a close fight," added Manpreet. Australia beat India 8-0 in the final of CWG 2010, further winning 4-0 in the CWG 2014 final. They also beat India 7-1 in Tokyo Olympics 2020.

390.title: We strengthen our party, we don't weaken other: BJP's Shahnawaz to JD(U)
390.article_body: Reacting to reports that many JD(U) MLAs and MLCs told Bihar CM Nitish Kumar that their present alliance has been trying to weaken them since 2020, BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain said, "We strengthen our own party, we don't weaken any other party." He further informed that he is going to Patna and the party leadership will give an official statement.

391.title: UP man smothers 13-yr-old boy to death after failed sexual assault
391.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly smothering a 13-year-old boy to death after he failed to sexually assault the boy in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor, police said. The boy's naked body was found on August 4 in a forested area after he went missing the day before. Bijnor SP said that the accused had confessed to the crime during interrogation.

392.title: Man issues threat to bomb UP CM Yogi over police helpline
392.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police's emergency WhatsApp helpline reportedly received a message threatening to kill Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. The man, identified as Shahid, threatened to bomb the Chief Minister on the Dial-112 helpline, police said. An FIR has been filed at Lucknow's Sushant Golf City police station in the matter, and several teams have been formed to arrest the accused.

393.title: Mirchi Baba held for allegedly raping woman on pretext of helping her conceive in MP
393.article_body: Self-proclaimed godman Baba Vairagyanand Giri or Mirchi Baba has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman in MP who went to seek his blessings to have a child. The woman alleged that the incident took place in July and that she was fed intoxicating pills and raped. Mirchi Baba was arrested from a Gwalior hotel and brought to Bhopal.

394.title: Chicago-based coupon-finding firm Groupon fires over 500 employees
394.article_body: Groupon has fired more than 500 employees, which is 15% of its 3,416 headcount, the Chicago-based company confirmed to a media outlet. This has hit employees in merchant development, sales, recruiting, engineering, product and marketing teams. CEO Kedar Deshpande said that the layoffs and reinvestments in marketing will help the company generate positive cash flow by the end of 2022.

395.title: Chhattisgarh minor kills parents as sacrifice to cure ill brother
395.article_body: A 17-year-old boy in Chhattisgarh killed his parents by offering them in sacrifice at the behest of a tantric, to cure his mentally unstable elder brother, the police said on Tuesday. The tantric told the minor that his parents had done some black magic on his elder brother and he would recover if they killed their parents, an officer said.

396.title: Nitish Kumar resigns as Bihar CM
396.article_body: JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday and tendered his resignation as the state's Chief Minister. This comes after Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP. According to reports, he will stake claim to form a new government in the state with the support of Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD.

397.title: Our party will remain with NDA: RLJP President after Bihar CM ended ties with BJP
397.article_body: After Bihar Chief Minister ended his government's alliance with BJP on Tuesday, Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party President Pashupati Kumar Paras said his party will remain a part of NDA. "Earlier also an experiment was done between RJD & JDU but they can't stay together for long. Again such alliance is coming, it's not good sign for Bihar's development," he added.

398.title: Free education, healthcare isn't freebie, waiving off loans is: Kejriwal
398.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has filed an application in the Supreme Court, opposing a PIL against political parties promising 'freebies' during poll campaigns. "Providing free education and healthcare isn't a freebie, it's duty of any government," the party's national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said. "Waiving off ₹10 lakh crore...loans is a freebie," he added, taking a dig at the Centre.

399.title: Tree planted by Bal Thackeray falls amid rains, BMC replants it at same spot
399.article_body: A Gulmohar tree planted by Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray at Shivaji Park ground fell due to heavy rains, an official said. However, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation officials replanted the tree at the same spot. "A wider and deeper ditch was dug, root hormones were applied to the tree along with fertilisers before replantation," the BMC statement said.

400.title: 2 electrocuted, 10 hurt during procession on eve of Muharram in Guj
400.article_body: Two people died due to electrocution and 10 others were injured after they came in contact with a live electric wire during a 'Tazia' procession on the eve of Muharram in Gujarat's Jamnagar, police said on Tuesday. 'Tazia' is a miniature replica of Prophet Muhammad's grandson Imam Hussain's tomb. The injured people were admitted to a hospital, Jamnagar SP said.

401.title: Viral clip shows students hitting each other with belts at birthday party in UP hospital
401.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows some pharmacy students creating a ruckus while celebrating a birthday in a civil hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. Higher authorities have initiated an inquiry into the matter. The video shows the students hitting each other playfully with belts and running around the place.
